column1: 4104740820,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-scalapay-4104740820?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=SUobieafVaph2BBC8iG06A%3D%3D&trackingId=KOvzVjfC5WUJFrVYWaEQ1A%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Scalapay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn‚Äôt stop us from becoming a unicorn ü¶Ñ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ‚ô•

Our data team seeks a Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay‚Äôs key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.
Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support
Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement
Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights
Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data
Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes
Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation
Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay
Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.
You‚Äôll be great for this role if:
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech
You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus
You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling
You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses
You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way
You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas
You‚Äôre more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!
Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000‚Ç¨ (Gross Annual Base)
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.
Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team
Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role
Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders, conducted in our Milan office
Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay‚Äôs values and assess cultural alignment.
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English üòâ
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but‚Ä¶ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Il Gruppo Finiper Canova √® alla ricerca di un/una Analista ESG in STAGE per supportare il team nella gestione dei dati ESG, nell‚Äôanalisi e nella reportistica.
La figura si occuper√†, in supporto ai colleghi, di analizzare e monitorare le performance ESG aziendali, supportando anche la gestione di progetti legati alla sostenibilit√†.
Raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare dati ESG per misurare le performance aziendali e identificare opportunit√† di miglioramento.
Supportare la redazione dei report ESG (ad esempio, Bilancio di Sostenibilit√†, reporting GRI, TCFD, ecc.) per stakeholder interni ed esterni.
Garantire l'accuratezza e l'affidabilit√† dei dati ESG, collaborando con altri dipartimenti per ottenere le informazioni necessarie.
Supportare la gestione di progetti di sostenibilit√†, come iniziative di economia circolare, efficienza energetica o engagement dei dipendenti.
Monitorare e aggiornare il team sulle evoluzioni normative e sugli standard di settore legati alla rendicontazione ESG.
Contribuire alla creazione di dashboard e strumenti di visualizzazione dei dati per comunicare in modo chiaro e trasparente le prestazioni ESG.
Partecipare alla promozione di una cultura della sostenibilit√† all'interno dell‚Äôorganizzazione.
Laurea in Economia, Scienze Ambientali, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini.
Buona conoscenza degli standard di reporting ESG (es. GRI, SASB, TCFD) e dei nuovi indicatori ESRS previsti dalla CSRD.
Eccellenti capacit√† analitiche, con padronanza di strumenti come Excel, Power BI o altri software di analisi dati.
Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli, con capacit√† organizzative e di gestione documentale.
Ottime capacit√† comunicative, scritte e orali, con predisposizione al lavoro in team.
Esperienza di 1 anno in ambito ESG, sostenibilit√† o analisi dei dati (anche attraverso stage o tirocini) verr√† considerata un plus.

La selezione √® rivolta a candidati dell‚Äôuno e dell‚Äôaltro sesso ai sensi del D. Lgs. 198/2006. Tutte le candidature devono essere accompagnate dalla autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali e saranno gestite ai sensi del Regolamento Europeo 2016/679 ( c.d. GDPR).

4187402160,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/fraud-data-analyst-at-subito-4187402160?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=SUobieafVaph2BBC8iG06A%3D%3D&trackingId=i3iaJH52gREb3nJIc8fMgg%3D%3D,Fraud Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are

We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Fraud Data Analyst to join our Content & Safety team. The Fraud Data Analyst will play a critical role in protecting our users and platform by identifying, analysing, and mitigating fraudulent activities. This position requires a strong analytical mindset, proficiency in data analysis tools, and a passion for problem-solving.
Data Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to identify patterns and trends indicative of fraudulent behaviour
Fraud Detection: Help develop and implement fraud detection models and rules to proactively identify and prevent fraudulent activities and non-compliant behaviours in general
Reporting: Prepare and present regular reports on fraud trends, detection rates, and mitigation efforts to management and stakeholders
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Product, and Customer Support, to investigate and resolve fraud cases
Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date on the latest fraud trends and techniques, and continuously improve fraud detection and prevention strategies.
Experience: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in fraud detection, risk management or Trust & Safety area
Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau) would be a plus
Detail-oriented: Ability to identify subtle patterns and anomalies in data
Proactive: Takes initiative to identify and address potential fraud risks
Collaborative: Works effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve common goals
Adaptable: Thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Ethical: Maintains high standards of integrity and confidentiality.
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=SUobieafVaph2BBC8iG06A%3D%3D&trackingId=Y1sxkMViS2pDU75o4otoVQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

4198011874,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/strategy-insight-analytics-intern-at-danone-4198011874?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=SUobieafVaph2BBC8iG06A%3D%3D&trackingId=SjhbSf3AgSGA%2BIc1pR8kiQ%3D%3D,"Strategy, Insight & Analytics Intern",Danone,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","About The Job
For our Strategy & Insight team in Milan we are looking as of now for a Strategy, Insight & Analytics Intern.
During your internship you‚Äôll be part of a dynamic team and you‚Äôll have visibility on all the company‚Äôs departments and you‚Äôll contribute to the achievements of your team.

You‚Äôll collaborate with several company‚Äôs departments (Sales, Trade Marketing & Category, Marketing and Supply Chain) to develop your analytical skills and to discover competitive dynamics of fresh dairy products‚Äô market.
In details, you‚Äôll be involved on
Critical analysis to understand the market‚Äôs dynamics and competitors
Sales and market trends analysis and consumers‚Äô behavior analysis (based on IRI database)
Support on projects based on qualitative and quantitative researches
Management of relationships with analysis agencies and stakeholders
To be able to achieve the above and be successful in this role, we believe you need to have
Master‚Äôs degree in Economics or Marketing or Management Engineering
Structured and analytical way of working
Previous international and/or internship experience will be a plus

As a world leading food company DANONE stands for international success. Around 104000 employees work on all five continents in the three Danone business areas Essential Dairy & Plant-Based, Specialized Nutrition and Water on one corporate mission ‚ÄúBringing health through food to as many people as possible‚Äù.

We want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people must impact the world through their daily choices. Each time we eat and drink, we vote for the world we want to live in. We believe a healthy body needs healthy food and healthy food needs a healthy planet this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies.
Do things your way. The way you work, the way you develop, the way you progress, it‚Äôs all up to you.

Working here you‚Äôll need to enjoy a fast-pace, complexity and it can get a little challenging. But it‚Äôs packed with opportunities. You‚Äôll work with some of the best-known brands in the world and we absolutely guarantee that you can just be yourself.
Be innovative and entrepreneurial and the impact you could make might just amaze you. Join our movement for a healthier world. One Planet One Health BY YOU.
Physical because our offices are centrally located and easily reached by public transportation. Free water, yogurt and fruits are of course benefits for our employees.

Digital as we work for objectives, without time or space constraints, in a responsible, autonomous and flexible way that helps to reconcile life and work times, improving productivity and focusing on results.

We offer you a culture, where you‚Äôll be welcomed to bring in ideas and take initiative. You‚Äôll learn from colleagues highly committed and passionate about what they do. We believe in learning something new each day as it means you keep growing every day!
We believe everyone has talent, something which comes natural to you. Your uniqueness is something which brings both excellence as well as energizes you.
In Italy we are Certified Great Place to Work and B Corp.

Danone is committed to create and live an inclusive & diverse environment, which will drive our growth as a business, as teams, as members of communities & as individuals. Valuing diversity is recognizing and respecting human differences and similarities. Our aim is to ensure that all employees and applicants are given equal opportunity and that our organization is representative of our consumers and society.

We commit to foster an inclusive working environment where we celebrate all types of diversity, both visible and invisible, which includes age, race, gender, nationality, disability, background, education, religion, beliefs, thinking style, perspectives and sexual orientation.
We believe that our differences will make the difference.
Your personal data will be processed in compliance with the EU Regulation 2016/679.

4183949754,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-kmd-4183949754?position=23&pageNum=0&refId=SUobieafVaph2BBC8iG06A%3D%3D&trackingId=HPSDtEdb8rVOfjNDSb1c2A%3D%3D,Business Data Analyst,KMD,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","KMD, Master Dealer Nazionale di: Fastweb, Tiscali, Linkem, Eolo e SKY, per ampliamento del proprio organico, √® alla ricerca di una figura da inserire all‚Äôinterno del team di Data Analysis.

Stiamo cercando una persona in grado di utilizzare i dati aziendali in modo tale da trarne informazioni azionabili e rilevanti. La principale responsabilit√† sar√† legata alla predisposizione di dashboard e strumenti di sintesi accurati, affidabili e di veloce interpretazione, finalizzati a fornire al management una chiara visione dell‚Äôandamento aziendale.

Il profilo avr√† come principale area di competenza la cura nel dettaglio degli strumenti di Business Intelligence legata ai servizi TLC, ma avr√† anche la possibilit√† di supportare l‚Äôintero Gruppo (www.dune.it) che da oltre 25 anni investe in societ√† Tech e di Consulenza IT.
A titolo esemplificativo, di seguito alcune attivit√† che potrebbero occupare la persona inserita:
Creazione diverse sintetiche da DB aziendale
Elaborazione e interpretazione dati, analisi risultati utilizzando tecniche statistiche

4199463044,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-mainstreaming-4199463044?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=SUobieafVaph2BBC8iG06A%3D%3D&trackingId=YcuqfdAjt9rmCenRIWD4qQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,MainStreaming,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","MainStreaming¬Æ is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment

We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.
Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.

Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2: Master's degree preferred.

column1: 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.
Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.
Execution & Precision: Strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and accuracy in financial reporting.
Ownership & Accountability: Taking responsibility for work, following through on commitments, and delivering high-quality results.
Adaptability & Resilience: Thriving in a fast-paced environment, responding well to change, and maintaining professionalism under pressure.
Collaboration & Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.
A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills

In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

MainStreaming¬Æ is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment


Data Analyst


Job Description:


We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
  • Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
  • Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
  • Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.
  • Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
  • Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2:
Master's degree preferred.
  • 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
  • Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.


    • Skills:


    • Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
    • Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
    • Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
    • Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
    • Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
    • Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.


    Competencies:


    • Execution &

  • Collaboration &

Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
  • Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.


    • What we offer:


    • A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
    • Flexible working hours.
    • Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
    • Access to E-Learning platform.
    • Health Insurance


    Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills


    In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

    MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Who are we?

We are Analysys Mason ‚Äì an award winning global management consulting firm helping clients to make and act on the decisions that steer their progress and connect our world.

Specialising in technology, telecoms, media and space sectors, we provide bespoke transformation, value creation, transaction, strategy and regulation and policy consulting, combined with research and insights. We help clients navigate complex transformation journeys, always shaping the next.

Since 1985, our team has expanded to 400+ professionals across 16 offices in 12 countries and our experts have taken on work in over 140 countries, making us a truly global company.

Our vision is to be the leading authority and catalyst for digital change, connectivity and inclusion. We are committed to a sustainable, connected future ‚Äì contributing to a world where technology delivers for all.



Job Description

Our graduate opportunities have a strong record of establishing early career foundations and developing well-rounded industry skills in our associate consultants.

You will work on a diverse mix of international projects with the best-known brands in the industry, applying our deep domain expertise and methodology to solve complex business issues.

You will attend our three-week comprehensive training programme where you will learn essential consulting skills and industry knowledge through courses, networking and teamwork.

After completing the training, you will join project teams and provide strategic advice and high-quality analysis on all aspects of strategy planning, transaction support, regulation and transformation while continuing your professional development.

Because our project teams are small, you will regularly get direct exposure to our world-class TMT experts, not only in your office, but also across our global locations. You will receive hands-on mentoring from experienced members of the team, including our Partners.

Our culture is collaborative and team-oriented, and you will have an impact on project delivery from an early stage, which will provide a steep learning curve and a structured career progression.

Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:

  • conducting high-quality research
  • offering quantitative and qualitative analysis of that research
  • gathering and interpreting numerical data
  • modelling and forecasting using various pieces of software
  • presenting your main findings in written, graphical and live form
  • contributing to proposal creation and client meetings
  • collaborating with other teams across our global locations
  • developing deep sector knowledge
  • and more.

Qualifications

If you are a problem-solver who is critical and analytical in your approach, then this is the right job for you.

You must have graduated by September 2025, or earlier, and you must have a degree from any academic background (including STEM, Humanities and others).

You must enjoy working with numbers as we are a quantitative data-driven business.

As long as you are keen to learn about the sector, you do not need to have a TMT background. As a matter of fact, many of our consultants only became TMT experts after joining us.

You must be fluent in English and Italian.



Additional Information

On top of an exciting opportunity, we offer many attractive benefits, including:

  • an annual bonus
  • private health and dental care
  • flexible working
  • your birthday off
  • 2 promotion cycles a year
  • stepped career progression
  • continuous training for professional and personal development
  • career coaching programmes
  • volunteering days.

We are proud to be an equal-opportunities employer and ensure fair work practices for all our employees, clients, candidates and other associated persons.



Our values

Excellence | We are passionate and aspire to be the industry benchmark.

Partnership | We are one team, and we inspire, motivate and coach each other.

Innovation | We are problem-solvers, and we do not share away from a challenge.

Integrity | We treat people with dignity and respect.

Empowerment | We motivate, inspire and train our people to be the best they can be.

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.
Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.
Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).

The successful candidate will join the Business Intelligence team in the data analyst role with the following responsibilities:

  • Requirements collection from business users and analysis of necessary information to be integrated into the DWH
  • Evolution of DWH data model in accordance with Group guidelines
  • ETL procedure management and development with azure data factory tool
  • Monitoring of data quality for appropriate use in business reporting
  • Setting and monitoring business KPIs to improve business performance
  • Develop reports and dashboards with Business Intelligence tools
  • Support users to perform analysis on DWH data and functional support for data navigation

Key Requirements/Skills/Experience

  • Proven experience (e.g. 2-3 years) as a Data Analyst or Data Engineer
  • University degree in scientific-technological studies
  • Strong Experience with cloud based infrastructures, Microsoft Azure platform will be preferred.
  • Knowledge of scripting languages, such as Python, R.
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL language and MS SQL Server)
  • Experience in design, implementation, maintenance of ETL pipelines in cloud environments to collect data from different sources
  • Strong knowledge of and experience of Azure Data Factory
  • Knowledge and experience of messaging system (Kafka)
  • Experience in data manipulation and Business Intelligence tools , Power BI will be preferred
  • Knowledge and experience of Azure Databricks
  • Communication and Interpersonal Skills
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Accuracy and attention to detail
  • Fluent in Italian and English
  • Work Experience in the insurance industry will be preferred

Budget Preparation Support: assisting in the preparation of annual budgets and financial forecasts.
Performance Monitoring: tracking financial performance against budgets and forecasts, identifying variances.
Strategic Decision Support: providing analytical support for strategic decisions, such as investment evaluations.
Cross-functional Collaboration: working closely with other departments to ensure financial decisions align with overall business goals.
Master‚Äôs degree in economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Math or Engineering.
Good understanding of Office suite and Business Intelligence tools.
Interpersonal skills, result oriented, proactivity, autonomy, relational skills, team working.
Good knowledge of English and Italian language (spoken, written).
Knowledge of programming languages (i.e. SQL, Python, R, etc.)
Experience in applied Machine Learning and Predictive Analytics.
Deep knowledge of business intelligence tools.
To find out more about the specific business, have a look at www.siemens-healthineers.com.

Per la nostra sede di Milano (Piazza Trento) siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come CONTRACT DATA ANALYST all‚Äôinterno della struttura Customer Rating & Contract Management. A2A Energia. Societ√† del Gruppo A2A che fornisce energia a oltre 2,5 milioni di clienti, costantemente ai vertici delle rilevazioni nazionali per il livello di soddisfazione. Predisporre la reportistica di andamento del servizio dei fornitori

Capacit√† di lettura e comprensione di documentazione contrattuale

Rappresenta un plus l‚Äôesperienza pregressa di 1-2 anni nel campo dell‚Äôanalisi dati in aziende del settore Energy/Utility, Telecomunicazioni o in aziende di consulenza per clienti finali in questi settori
Rappresenta un plus la conoscenza degli applicativi Qlik View, Qlik Sense, Google Cloud Platform o altri linguaggi di programmazione

Completano il profilo: flessibilit√†, dinamicit√†, orientamento al teamworking, capacit√† relazionali con stakeholder interni ed esterni, concretezza e spirito collaborativo, problem solving, proattivit√† e iniziativa, autonomia, gestione dello stress e delle priorit√†, capacit√† di analisi e di pianificazione/organizzazione del lavoro.

Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attivit√† sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare

4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=YN7st38WxuT%2BMYiZ9rdiJQ%3D%3D&trackingId=htgkb2LaQgbdTjUgDUr7GA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.
Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.

Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.

column2: Master's degree preferred.

column1: 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.

Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.
A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills

In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

MainStreaming¬Æ is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

Data Analyst


Job Description:


We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
  • Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
  • Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
  • Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.
  • Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
  • Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2:
Master's degree preferred.
  • 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
  • Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.


    • Skills:


    • Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
    • Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
    • Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
    • Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
    • Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
    • Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.


    Competencies:


    • Execution &
column3:

  • Ownership &

  • Collaboration &
column6:
Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
  • Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.


    • What we offer:


    • A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
    • Flexible working hours.
    • Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
    • Access to E-Learning platform.
    • Health Insurance


    Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills


    In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

    MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

fifty-five √® una data-company di un nuovo genere che aiuta i brand a sfruttare i dati per migliorare il marketing, i media e l'esperienza del cliente grazie a una combinazione di servizi di consulenza e tecnologia specializzata, pilastro del Brandtech Group nel settore data e marketing, propone un'ampia gamma di servizi che fondono consulenza strategica, services cloud, expertise media e miglioramento della customer experience.

fifty-five conta pi√π di 400 esperti digitali. Consulenti digitali, specialisti di tracking e media, ingegneri e data scientist lavorano in sinergia per fornire consulenze di marketing di alto livello e assistenza tecnica ai brand in tutti i settori, in tutto il mondo.

Come partner fidato degli inserzionisti nella gestione dei dati per la loro raccolta, attivazione e valorizzazione,¬† supportiamo le organizzazioni nel divenire realt√† omnicanale efficaci attraverso la gestione dell'ecosistema digitale e l'integrazione con il mondo fisico.

Con sede a Parigi, operiamo su 3 fusi orari dai nostri 10 uffici situati a Parigi, Londra, Ginevra, Milano, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore e New York. Fifty-five attribuisce particolare importanza al benessere dei suoi collaboratori.

Dopo una fase di onboarding approfondito nel nostro ufficio di Milano, utilizzerete la vostra expertise delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag management systems (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.
In qualit√† di Junior Digital Analyst, farete leva sulla vostra padronanza tecnica delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag manager (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.
Implementazione tecnica delle soluzioni tracking dei siti web/mobile o app del cliente, dalla raccolta delle esigenze alla raccolta effettiva dei dati di cui garantirete qualit√† e affidabilit√†
Gestire i progetti a contatto con il cliente (garantendo l'avanzamento delle missioni, pianificazione, strategia di test, consegne) sulle problematiche di raccolta dati Analytics e Media
Condividere le vostre conoscenze e competenze con i clienti e internamente
Mantenere un collegamento permanente con i diversi attori lato cliente/integratore
Sviluppare un know-how operativo dettagliato (TMS & Analytics)
Sviluppare nuove opportunit√† di business in collaborazione con i consulenti responsabili del conto
Partecipare alla definizione dei prodotti e degli strumenti interni dell'azienda

Esperienza nella gestione progetti interfacciandosi con team digitali ed IT

Un ambiente multiculturale con collaboratori di oltre 20 nazionalit√† diverse

Formazione continua (e riconosciuta) sull'ecosistema, le tecnologie digitali e sulle soft skills (es: public speaking, gestione del team ecc.)

Possibilit√† di partecipare a progetti interni come Data Hive (un progetto ""tech for good"" promosso dai dipendenti di fifty-five, il cui scopo √® mettere le loro conoscenze e competenze a disposizione di organizzazioni benefiche), DEI@55 (un gruppo di lavoro sui temi della diversit√† e dell'inclusione all'interno di fifty-five e della tecnologia pi√π in generale), Sustainability@55 (un team che aiuta a implementare pratiche sostenibili internamente e presso i nostri clienti).

In fifty-five, siamo convinti che la diversit√† e l'inclusione siano vere forze. Ci impegniamo a garantire parit√† di trattamento di tutte le candidature ricevute, senza distinzione di genere, et√†, origine, orientamento sessuale, stato di salute o opinione politica o religiosa. 4208664133,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-internship-at-allianz-trade-in-italia-4208664133?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=YN7st38WxuT%2BMYiZ9rdiJQ%3D%3D&trackingId=yOMmSfLMUB6wlOVoovbUxQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst Internship,Allianz Trade in Italia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","About Us

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.
What You Should Know Before Applying

At Allianz, we are committed to ensure a fair hiring process and minimize unconscious bias during the screening phase. At this regard, we ask each candidate to submit their resume including only the essential information for an objective and transparent assessment of skills and experience. For example, it‚Äôs preferable to omit the photo or the city of residence before submitting the CV.
You will be placed in our Milan/Rome office, within the Transformation team, where you will be responsible for supporting process automation and developing data-driven solutions.
You will be primarily responsible for the following activities:
Collaborate with business analysts or automation engineers to identify opportunities for process improvements.
Provide data-driven recommendations to support the design and implementation of automation solutions.
Assist in the development of models or algorithms for predictive analytics or decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain dashboards and regular reports that provide insights into business processes and the performance of automation systems.
Create visual representations of data that can be understood by stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Automate reporting processes where possible to provide real-time data and insights.
You Are the Ideal Candidate If‚Ä¶
You have proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation, and familiarity with programming languages, primarily Python and VBA.
You are competent with data visualization tools like Power BI and have basic knowledge of automation tools for business processes.
You possess skills in cleaning and preparing datasets for analysis, and experience with Excel or similar tools for data manipulation and analysis.
You have strong problem-solving aptitude to identify issues and propose data-driven solutions, and analytical thinking for evaluating data and process efficiencies.
You have collaboration skills to work effectively across different teams, and time management to handle multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.
Remote working? 10 days per month, plus some days of working from abroad.
360¬∞ well-being? We care about your health so you can benefit from dedicated support for your psychophysical well-being.
Discover a flexible and inclusive environment where your peace of mind and personal style truly matter.
Customer and Market Excellence: Unwavering commitment and expertise to provide maximum support to those who rely on us.
Collaborative Leadership: Valuing people, promoting a culture of feedback and collective well-being.
Entrepreneurship: Anticipating trends and taking risks in an environment that fosters innovation and responsibility.
Trust: Acting with integrity, honoring commitments, promoting diversity and inclusion, and acting transparently for corporate social responsibility.

Certified as a Great Place to Work, Allianz Trade Italia is recognized for its focus on Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) issues and for promoting a hybrid work environment that best integrates in-person and smart working modes.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

About Us

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.


What You Should Know Before Applying

At Allianz, we are committed to ensure a fair hiring process and minimize unconscious bias during the screening phase. At this regard, we ask each candidate to submit their resume including only the essential information for an objective and transparent assessment of skills and experience. For example, it‚Äôs preferable to omit the photo or the city of residence before submitting the CV.


Your Challenge

You will be placed in our Milan/Rome office, within the Transformation team, where you will be responsible for supporting process automation and developing data-driven solutions.

You will be primarily responsible for the following activities:

  • Collaborate with business analysts or automation engineers to identify opportunities for process improvements.
  • Provide data-driven recommendations to support the design and implementation of automation solutions.
  • Assist in the development of models or algorithms for predictive analytics or decision-making processes.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and regular reports that provide insights into business processes and the performance of automation systems.
  • Create visual representations of data that can be understood by stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
  • Automate reporting processes where possible to provide real-time data and insights.


You Are the Ideal Candidate If‚Ä¶

  • You have proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation, and familiarity with programming languages, primarily Python and VBA.
  • You are competent with data visualization tools like Power BI and have basic knowledge of automation tools for business processes.
  • You possess skills in cleaning and preparing datasets for analysis, and experience with Excel or similar tools for data manipulation and analysis.
  • You have strong problem-solving aptitude to identify issues and propose data-driven solutions, and analytical thinking for evaluating data and process efficiencies.
  • You have collaboration skills to work effectively across different teams, and time management to handle multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.


Why Working With Us?

  • Remote working? 10 days per month, plus some days of working from abroad.
  • 360¬∞ well-being? We care about your health so you can benefit from dedicated support for your psychophysical well-being.
  • Discover a flexible and inclusive environment where your peace of mind and personal style truly matter.


Our Values

  • Customer and Market Excellence: Unwavering commitment and expertise to provide maximum support to those who rely on us.
  • Collaborative Leadership: Valuing people, promoting a culture of feedback and collective well-being.
  • Entrepreneurship: Anticipating trends and taking risks in an environment that fosters innovation and responsibility.
  • Trust: Acting with integrity, honoring commitments, promoting diversity and inclusion, and acting transparently for corporate social responsibility.


Certified as a Great Place to Work, Allianz Trade Italia is recognized for its focus on Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) issues and for promoting a hybrid work environment that best integrates in-person and smart working modes.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

Are you an Automotive fan and you have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements, and in this way support dealers to reach growth opportunities? Would you like to be part of a renowned Automotive company, applying your professional skills and gain experience? Then we might be looking for you!
The main purpose of the Data Analyst is:
support the parts sales team and Parts Managers
collect, collate and analyse various internal and external composite data
identify and prioritise parts sales growth opportunities at National & Dealer levels.
Identification and collation of key data from both internal and external sources
Analysis of data, identifying key opportunities for parts sales growth at both National and Dealer levels.
Collect and provide market intelligence and analysis to assist formulation of current and future parts sales marketing strategy
Ongoing analysis and reporting from all programme channels and activities
Focus at all times to achieve nationally set KPI and ‚Ç¨‚Äôs growth objectives
Assist in the building of MSX programme tools, ensuring ongoing correct usage and fit for purpose
Direct communications link between programme activity and client management
Attend and contribute to regular programme meetings
Ensure effective communication and feedback with all parts (MSXI ‚Äì MSX Italy team ‚Äì BMW)
Ensure timely and accurate reporting as per programme requirements
Attend other meetings as required, providing results, feedback and market intelligence
Cooperate and collaborate (Team working and team building)
Training for new analyst (training on the job)
Inform the Sales Reps, Parts Manager, Project Coordinator and Project Manager about the critical situations
Take care of the company assets (usage in line with company policies, managing and maintenance)
Correct and professional implementation of the project
Propose project improvements (new implementation tools and activities, training material, etc.)
Provide a good level of job
Inform Parts Managers, Project Coordinator, PM and BMW on achievements or concerns within ongoing activities
High level of literacy and numeracy -
High level of computer literacy, especially MS Excel and MS Access
Ability to design and deliver Microsoft Word and PowerPoint Presentations
Degree in engineering, economics, business administration or statistic.
Previous experiences in the same role are appreciated.

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Job Description

Are you an Automotive fan and you have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements, and in this way support dealers to reach growth opportunities? Would you like to be part of a renowned Automotive company, applying your professional skills and gain experience? Then we might be looking for you!

Purpose Of The Position

The main purpose of the Data Analyst is:

  • support the parts sales team and Parts Managers
  • collect, collate and analyse various internal and external composite data
  • identify and prioritise parts sales growth opportunities at National &
column2:
Dealer levels.

Duties

  • Identification and collation of key data from both internal and external sources
  • Analysis of data, identifying key opportunities for parts sales growth at both National and Dealer levels.
  • Collect and provide market intelligence and analysis to assist formulation of current and future parts sales marketing strategy
  • Ongoing analysis and reporting from all programme channels and activities
  • Focus at all times to achieve nationally set KPI and ‚Ç¨‚Äôs growth objectives

Alkemy √® una societ√† internazionale specializzata nell‚Äôevoluzione del modello di business di grandi e medie aziende e una public company quotata sul mercato MTA STAR di Borsa Italiana.

La nostra mission √® di migliorare la posizione di mercato e la competitivit√† delle grandi e medie aziende stimolando l‚Äôevoluzione del modello di business in coerenza con l‚Äôinnovazione tecnologica e i comportamenti dei consumatori. Grazie a un team di oltre 1000 persone, integriamo competenze nelle aree di Strategy, Communication, Design, Performance, Technology, Insights & Analytics con un‚Äôofferta, pensata per il contesto post-digital, che copre l‚Äôintera catena del valore dalla strategia all‚Äôimplementazione.

Per il potenziamento dell‚Äôarea di Data & Analytics (former Nunatac SpA), Alkemy √® alla ricerca di un Neolaureati e Laureandi da inserire come Data Scientist Intern. La Mission di questa area √® di accompagnare le aziende nel loro percorso di crescita, aiutandole a fondare la propria strategia sui dati e sulla conoscenza che da essi deriva. √à composta da Data Scientists e Data Engineers che formano un team dinamico, informale e rigoroso al lavoro su applicazioni di Advanced Analytics innovative e di valore.

Lavorare nell‚Äôarea Data & Analytics significa affrontare tutte le sfide legate all'uso di metodi quantitativi, dalle tecniche statistiche consolidate agli approcci pionieristici di Machine Learning e Deep Learning applicati ai Big Data, per ottenere un impatto reale sul business dei nostri clienti. Siamo in continua crescita e cerchiamo nuove persone che sappiano combinare le competenze tecniche con la visione, l'intraprendenza e la passione per i dati.
Esperienza: Neolaureati o laureandi (meno di 6 mesi dalla prova finale)
Laurea in ambito scientifico (statistica, matematica, fisica, economia. informatica)
Forte interesse in ambito gestione ed analisi dei dati, data visualization, advanced analytics, machine/deep learning
Ottima capacit√† di lavorare in gruppo
Conoscenza di SQL e, anche base, del mondo SAS, R e Python
Stage retribuito finalizzato all'inserimento in Azienda.

In Alkemy ci impegniamo costantemente nel creare le migliori condizioni affinch√© tutte le nostre persone sentano di poter esprimere al meglio il proprio valore ed il proprio talento - e possano sentire Alkemy come casa propria - indipendentemente da genere, et√†, nazionalit√†, orientamento sessuale e religioso.

Siamo da sempre profondamente convinti che un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo che valorizzi tutte le diversit√† sia non solo un imperativo valoriale, ma un fattore critico di successo per il nostro business. Aggreghiamo sotto lo stesso tetto persone con professionalit√† e background molto diversi e da sempre promuoviamo una cultura di condivisione e crescita continua.

Eccellenza, Passione, Integrit√† e Concretezza sono i valori fondanti di Alkemy, che tutti noi condividiamo e che ci guidano nel realizzare la nostra mission. I valori Alkemy definiscono la nostra identit√† e sono alla base della nostra cultura organizzativa, indirizzano i nostri comportamenti nei confronti di tutte le nostre persone e dei nostri clienti, costruendo evolutivamente il nostro approccio al business.

I profili ritenuti in linea verranno contattati entro 20 giorni. Non saranno valutate candidature sprovviste di cv completo allegato. I dati dei candidati verranno trattati ai sensi dell‚ÄôInformativa Privacy sempre consultabile sul nostro sito.alkemy.com
