4187704643,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-geo-analytics-iv-remote-at-agile-lab-4187704643?position=9&pageNum=5&refId=mG7i8SjKFizfCbOcjAX7Pg%3D%3D&trackingId=V%2BSmPmQxtKEf3VCy%2Bgbr%2BA%3D%3D,Data Analyst - Geo Analytics IV (Remote),Agile Lab,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Agile Lab is a company founded in 2014 with the mission to create value for its customers in data-intensive environments through customizable solutions that establish performance-driven processes, sustainable architectures, and automated platforms based on data governance best practices.

Having delivered over 100 successful Elite Data Engineering initiatives, we have used this experience to create Witboost: a modular, technology-agnostic platform that enables modern organizations to discover, value, and produce their data in both traditional environments and fully compliant Data Mesh architectures.
With a highly skilled team of over 220 data engineers based in Europe, Agile Lab helps organizations with their data-driven transformation.
Take a look at our handbook to discover our core values and processes.
We are looking for a‚ÄØData Analyst - Geo Analytics‚ÄØIV to join our team.
Analyze and interpret large datasets, particularly geospatial data, to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain geo-analytics systems using platforms like ESRI ArcGIS and other GIS tools.
Design workflows and processes for data collection, cleaning, and analysis of geospatial data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate geospatial data into broader business strategies.
Assist in the creation of visual representations (maps, dashboards) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
Mentor junior team members in data analysis techniques and geospatial tools.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in geo-analytics and data science.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Math, Computer Science or a related field.
+ 6 years of previous experience in analyzing geospatial data and working with GIS platforms (ArcGIS, QGIS).
Proficiency in programming languages like Python and JavaScript for data analysis and web development.
Strong knowledge of SQL, PostgreSQL, and spatial databases (PostGIS).
Experience with open-source geospatial technologies and tools (GeoServer, OpenLayers).
Understanding of data visualization techniques and experience building dashboards.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions.
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate across teams.
Proactivity and willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.
Full Remote or hybrid working in our offices: Milan, Turin, Padua, Bologna, Catania and Rende
A structured career path with clear expectations and salary for each level
Support of a buddy in the first week of work
A coach as a guide in choosing the most suitable experiences for your ambitions
Benefits and corporate welfare programs: company prizes and welcome pack with all the equipment you need to work
Agile Nomads Experience: opportunity to work for 2 weeks abroad
Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you
The opportunity to attend one conference per year
A company rated 4.8 out of 5 for employee satisfaction on Glassdoor and certified as a Great Place to Work
Inclusive environment where you can be who you really are
Stimulating environment oriented to growth, both professional and personal.
Remote or smart working and work life balance
Training monthly budget: advanced training available
A structured career path with clear expectations and salary for each level
Welcome pack with all the equipment you need to work
The opportunity to attend one conference per year
Inclusive environment where you can be who you really are
Stimulating environment oriented to growth, both professional and personal.
We don't like hierarchies: we work as a team
We don't like bureaucracies, we prefer a sense of responsibility
We like data, certainly, so anything that is measurable
We want to make a positive change in our industry
Empathy, humility, collaboration, and willingness to challenge ourselves are the basis of our work.

This position is open to all candidates, regardless of gender, and we strongly encourage applications from both male and female candidates pursuant to Art. 27 of Legislative Decree no. 198/2006, as well as those who identify themselves as non-binary or of any other kind. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Agile Lab is a company founded in 2014 with the mission to create value for its customers in data-intensive environments through customizable solutions that establish performance-driven processes, sustainable architectures, and automated platforms based on data governance best practices.

Having delivered over 100 successful Elite Data Engineering initiatives, we have used this experience to create Witboost: a modular, technology-agnostic platform that enables modern organizations to discover, value, and produce their data in both traditional environments and fully compliant Data Mesh architectures.

With a highly skilled team of over 220 data engineers based in Europe, Agile Lab helps organizations with their data-driven transformation.

Take a look at our handbook to discover our core values and processes.

üíºThe opportunity:

We are looking for a‚ÄØData Analyst - Geo Analytics‚ÄØIV to join our team.

üí∞RAL:

‚Ç¨ 60K ‚Äì70K + 4K bonus pack

üíªResponsibilities:

  • Analyze and interpret large datasets, particularly geospatial data, to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
  • Develop and maintain geo-analytics systems using platforms like ESRI ArcGIS and other GIS tools.
  • Design workflows and processes for data collection, cleaning, and analysis of geospatial data.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate geospatial data into broader business strategies.
  • Assist in the creation of visual representations (maps, dashboards) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
  • Mentor junior team members in data analysis techniques and geospatial tools.
  • Stay up to date with the latest developments in geo-analytics and data science.

üõ†Ô∏èRequirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Math, Computer Science or a related field.
  • + 6 years of previous experience in analyzing geospatial data and working with GIS platforms (ArcGIS, QGIS).
  • Proficiency in programming languages like Python and JavaScript for data analysis and web development.
  • Strong knowledge of SQL, PostgreSQL, and spatial databases (PostGIS).
  • Experience with open-source geospatial technologies and tools (GeoServer, OpenLayers).
  • Understanding of data visualization techniques and experience building dashboards.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate across teams.
  • Proactivity and willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.

üõ†Ô∏è Responsibilities:

  • Full Remote or hybrid working in our offices: Milan, Turin, Padua, Bologna, Catania and Rende

NATO‚Äôs Public Diplomacy efforts serve a vital function within the Alliance by communicating its purpose and priorities to audiences worldwide. In fulfilling this role, the Public Diplomacy Division (PDD) actively strengthens NATO‚Äôs public image, thereby fostering trust in and support for the Alliance. The Division also acts as coordinator for strategic communication activities across all NATO civilian and military bodies and commands.

The Data Insights and Information Threats section sits within PDD. It comprises the Information Environment Assessment (IEA) Unit, Audience Research Team, and a team managing strategic communications policy and NATO‚Äôs work on countering information threats. The Information Environment Assessment Unit, comprised of an Analysis and a Data Team, is the engine that provides data and evidence-based analysis of, and insights into, the information environment. The Unit develops action-orientated reporting and alerting to help NATO improve its Strategic Communications, as well as engagement with relevant stakeholders internally and externally.

The incumbent carries out the duties of IEA Data Analyst in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. They are responsible for applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of multiple publicly and commercially available data sources and services. Additionally, the incumbent produces analytical products with actionable recommendations, supporting data-driven decision making and helping to ensure a strategic approach to PDD‚Äôs multifaceted communications. They also help to shape the acquisition and adoption of cutting-edge analytical tools to help NATO‚Äôs IEA capability evolve.
possess a university degree, from an institute of a recognized standing, in a field relevant for the role (preferably such as data science or international relations)
have 2 years of professional experience in data analytics, and qualitative and quantitative research methods
possess proven experience applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of traditional and social media
possess proven experience in developing reporting products for senior and/or executive audiences
be able to explain data as a convincing story
have excellent communication, drafting and oral presentation skills
have strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact within a multicultural team and with diverse stakeholders across the Organization
possess the following minimum levels of NATO‚Äôs official languages (English/French): V (‚ÄúAdvanced‚Äù) in one
column2: I (‚ÄúBeginner‚Äù) in the other.

column1: The following would be considered an advantage:
experience with quantitative methods and their application to trend analysis
basic knowledge of programming languages, such as Python
geographic expertise (Russia, China or/and Middle East North Africa)
experience with methods and techniques to evaluate and assess communications activities, including relevant measurement and assessment frameworks and tools

knowledge of and/or experience in analysing information threats, using publicly and commercially available data sources and services to characterize threat actors‚Äô campaigns, capabilities, and their tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs)
knowledge of and/or experience in implementing best-practice analytical methodologies to structure and scale data models for analysing information threats.

Contribute in an active, timely and well-coordinated manner to PDD‚Äôs work in the area of Information Environment Assessment, by delivering high quality reports including actionable recommendations based on the assessment of the information environment. Glean and share insights with PDD leadership on information threats targeting NATO.

Keep abreast of industry developments relevant to Information Environment Assessment, including emerging best practice analytical methodologies. Provide clear insight and recommendations to civilian and military staffs from multiple disciplines, including those directly responsible for analysing and evaluating information and communications products. Ensure that this expertise is translated into effective Information Environment Assessments reporting. Use sound political judgement when making recommendations on adjusting NATO‚Äôs communications based on regular analysis and assessment.

Apply data analytics to the collection and analysis of traditional and social media. Contribute to improving the quality, scope and operational relevance of the IEA reports delivered by PDD. Identify and analyse trends, and distil actionable insights to brief NATO communicators and decision-makers. Test traditional media, social media and disinformation analysis tools and advise on procurement and contracted services.

Work closely with the IEA Unit, Audience Research Team and StratCom policy team within the section to integrate IEA into the communications planning process and coordinate seamlessly with other sections within PDD. Develop and maintain professional relationships across the civilian and military staff to promote synergies within and between different disciplines, including intelligence, cyber, operations, data policy, logistics, and information management. Work with Allies and partners, including the European External Acton Service and G7 Rapid Response Mechanism, to exchange expertise related to analysing information threats. Coordinate effectively with various stakeholders in order to get useful inputs with actionable recommendations for the delivery of regular IEA reports. Identify, strengthen and build relationships with partners, researchers and other experts to become better informed on IEA.

Plan and deliver reports within tight deadlines on issues of relevance to PDD and senior NATO leadership. Demonstrate political acumen when selecting topics and analysing and assessing trends in the information environment. Work with other divisions at NATO to deliver briefings for senior NATO staff. Use initiative to recommend opportunities for Information Environment Assessment.
Perform any other related duty as assigned.

The incumbent carries out their duties under the overall direction of the Head, Information Environment Assessment Unit, and following day-to-day guidance of the Lead, Data Team . The incumbent maintains a close working relationship with other staff in the Unit, members of PDD, as well as counterparts in other Divisions, other NATO entities and in Allied Delegations and capitals.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO‚Äôs member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.
Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel R√©gulations.

The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours. Silbing is working with a leading organisation in Brussels looking for a Data Analyst to join on a 6-month contract (with likely extension). A great chance to shape high-impact projects in a fast-paced, international setting.


The role:


You‚Äôll work with large datasets, build dashboards, and deliver insights that directly support strategic decisions


Key responsibilities:


  • Analyse complex data to uncover trends and insights
  • Build and optimise dashboards (Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
  • Work closely with stakeholders to understand requirements
  • Translate data into clear recommendations
  • Support data quality initiatives


Requirements


  • 3+ years as a Data Analyst
  • Strong SQL and Excel
  • Experience with modern BI tools
  • Excellent communication ‚Äì English essential, Dutch/French a bonus
  • Proactive and independent mindset

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.

Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega‚Äôs centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.
Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:
Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.
Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.
Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.
We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carri√®re verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, ‚Ä¶
Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!
Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

  • Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
  • Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
  • Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
  • Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
  • Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.


Jouw vaardigheden

  • Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
  • Je hebt een analytische mindset.
  • Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
  • Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
  • Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
  • Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.


Bonuspunten als je ‚Ä¶

  • Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
  • Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
  • Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
  • Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.


Ons aanbod

  • We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
  • Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
  • Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carri√®re verder te ontwikkelen.
  • Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
  • Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, ‚Ä¶


Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.
Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank‚Äôs digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization
Master‚Äôs degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.

ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge: AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.

Location: Brussels (3 days per week onsite)

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong technical background, the ability to work with complex data, and experience engaging with multiple stakeholders.
Work within a feature team, analyzing large and complex datasets.
Write and optimize Python and SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
Utilize ETL processes and work within Azure Databricks.
Collaborate closely with Data Engineers and other technical teams.
Interpret and translate business needs into actionable insights.
Engage with multiple stakeholders across different departments.
Ensure data accuracy and contribute to decision-making processes.
4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with complex datasets.
Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, ETL, and Azure Databricks.
Ability to understand and dive into the technical aspect of data pipelines and code.
Experience working in large teams rather than small teams with a single analyst.
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain technical insights in a business-friendly manner.
Retail industry experience or a strong affinity for customer-related data.
Fluency in English and French (spoken and written).
Experience working with cloud platforms and modern data infrastructures.
Familiarity with customer analytics and behavioral data.

Second stage: Technical interview with team members.

Job Title: Permanent Data Analyst


Location: Brussels (3 days per week onsite)

Languages: English &
column2:
French

Seniority Level: 4+ years of experience

Reports to: Head of Analytics


About the Role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong technical background, the ability to work with complex data, and experience engaging with multiple stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities

  • Work within a feature team, analyzing large and complex datasets.
  • Write and optimize Python and SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
  • Utilize ETL processes and work within Azure Databricks.
  • Collaborate closely with Data Engineers and other technical teams.
  • Interpret and translate business needs into actionable insights.
  • Engage with multiple stakeholders across different departments.
  • Ensure data accuracy and contribute to decision-making processes.


Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with complex datasets.
  • Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, ETL, and Azure Databricks.
  • Ability to understand and dive into the technical aspect of data pipelines and code.
  • Experience working in large teams rather than small teams with a single analyst.
  • Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain technical insights in a business-friendly manner.
  • Retail industry experience or a strong affinity for customer-related data.
  • Fluency in English and French (spoken and written).


Nice-to-Have

  • Experience working with cloud platforms and modern data infrastructures.
  • Familiarity with customer analytics and behavioral data.


Interview Process

  1. First stage: Interview with HR and CTO.
  2. Second stage: Technical interview with team members.

4198440376,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/crm-data-analyst-at-nestl%C3%A9-nespresso-sa-4198440376?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=%2Fcy8CYrFSNeU4rxx9umX4A%3D%3D,CRM Data Analyst,Nestl√© Nespresso SA,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","CRM Data Analyst, this is your challenge

Do you have a passion for data, insights, and coffee? Do you want to work together with energized teams towards the most performing plans for the Belux market? By joining our CX&I team, you will be in charge of customers insights, be the database guardian and also further optimize our analytics corner.
A day in the life of a CRM Data Analyst:
In charge of monthly B2C & B2B CRM reporting from basic KPIs to forecasting net acquisition.
Perform statistical analysis through different tools (Nespresso is working with Adobe, Knime, Snowflake, PowerBI) and present recommendations to the business.
Optimize analytical worklfows through automation and forecasting with pre-built data science tools.
Maintain DataHub knowledge & documentation, share best pratices and be the first point of contact locally.
Lead & implement the new Martech solution followed by continuous improvement in usage & roll-out.
Lead yearly deep dives across departments (collect requests, time & build & deliver analytics to stakeholders).
Adhoc analysis for internal departments (boutique, e-sales, trade, B2B), both re-actively and pro-actively.

The Nespresso Marketing team consists of 17 persons operating in 4 distinct teams: Brand, Product, B2B and Customer experience & insights. You would be part of the later one which is a dynamic analytical team of 5 persons. The CX&I team collaborates with all the departments (Channels, Demand & supply, B2C,..) to nurture the company with insights thanks to Nespresso‚Äôs direct to consumer model. Our team is also the guardian of net acquisition and subscription on top of insights.
Degree in mathematics/statistics, or economic studies with large quantitative component.
More than 3 years of experience in data / analytics related activities in a business-oriented environment.
Understand SQL language & Snowflake (or having experience in coding).
Master OS office (Excel, Powerpoint, Word) and Power BI.
You have an open mindset and enjoy discovering new tools & approaches.
Knowledge about Adobe campaign and Adobe experience platform is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch and/or French AND English is mandatory.
A full-time position located in Brussels.
Excellent benefits, including an annual target bonus.
A variety of professional trainings and development programs.
Various career opportunities, both in Benelux and internationally.
Professional working environment, team spirit, company pride and passionate colleagues.
You will contribute to make Belux a better coffee place
Our recruiters would be glad to ask any pending questions. Feel free to send your questions to careers@be.nestle.com and you will receive an answer within 3 working days.
Applying for the role of CRM Data Analyst?
Great! If you see a match with the description as described above, we will gladly receive your cv and motivation. You can upload these via the link.

We use an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Tool to schedule interviews with our candidates. So keep an eye on your email for the interview invitation! When registering your application, you will be asked if we may send you whatsapp messages
column2: if you answer 'yes' to this, you will receive communication via whatsapp in addition to messages via email. Communication through our AI tool is in English, but our recruiters speak Dutch, English, and French.

4207728266,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-alten-belgium-4207728266?position=16&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=wmmsfwYNLY9Vi2AstNOudg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,ALTEN Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","üöÄ Job Opening: Data Scientist / Analyst ‚Äì Dataiku Platform

ALTEN Belgium is a leading technology consulting and engineering company, specializing in Engineering, Life Sciences, and IT services. With a strong presence across various sectors, including automotive, pharmaceuticals, and finance, ALTEN Belgium leverages its expertise to deliver innovative solutions to clients throughout the country. As part of the global ALTEN Group, the company combines local knowledge with international experience to drive technological advancement and support clients in achieving their goals.

At our clients company, data is at the heart of our transformation. Our Enterprise Data & Analytics function is evolving into a Center of Expertise (CoE), delivering advanced analytics, automation, and machine learning solutions.‚Äã

We are seeking a Data Scientist / Analyst with robust technical skills to engineer, optimize, and promote our Dataiku (DSS) platform, utilized by both expert and citizen data scientists. This role combines hands-on data science with platform optimization and support responsibilities.‚Äã
If you're a problem-solver passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and proficient in tools like Python, Git, Terraform, and AWS, this opportunity is for you.‚Äã
Design, build, and automate data workflows and analytics pipelines using Dataiku (DSS).‚Äã
Support internal teams and citizen data scientists in effective Dataiku utilization.‚Äã
Promote best practices in workflow structure, code quality, and governance.‚Äã
Manage and enhance our AWS-hosted Dataiku platform.‚Äã
Develop and maintain automation pipelines, integrations, and reusable components.‚Äã
Monitor and refine platform usability and performance.‚Äã
Collaborate with cloud, infrastructure, MLOps, and data governance teams.‚Äã
Assist in deploying ML pipelines into production alongside data science teams.‚Äã
Work with support teams to resolve issues and improve user experience.‚Äã
Create comprehensive guides, documentation, and tutorials.‚Äã
Contribute to the development of an internal knowledge base on analytics and Dataiku usage.
3+ years in data science, analytics, or data platform roles.
Proficient in Python, with working knowledge of Git and Terraform.
Good understanding of AWS infrastructure and cloud deployments.
Comfortable with automation, platform monitoring, and support.
Experience with MLOps, DevOps, or ML pipeline deployment.
Familiarity with platform governance and performance tuning.
Exposure to enterprise data environments and integration work.
Clear communicator across technical and non-technical teams.
Team player with a drive to learn and improve.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.‚Äã
Be part of a transformative journey in data utilization.
Collaborate with top-tier data teams and contribute to scaling a modern data science platform.‚Äã
Gain exposure to a diverse ecosystem of tools, projects, and business domains.‚Äã
Combine technical expertise with cross-functional impact in a dynamic, inclusive culture.
üîí Please note: ALTEN Belgium is only considering candidates who do not currently require a work permit and will not require one in the future to work in Belgium.

üöÄ Job Opening: Data Scientist / Analyst ‚Äì Dataiku Platform

üìç Location: Brussels

üíº Seniority: 3‚Äì5 years of experience


About ALTEN Belgium

ALTEN Belgium is a leading technology consulting and engineering company, specializing in Engineering, Life Sciences, and IT services. With a strong presence across various sectors, including automotive, pharmaceuticals, and finance, ALTEN Belgium leverages its expertise to deliver innovative solutions to clients throughout the country. As part of the global ALTEN Group, the company combines local knowledge with international experience to drive technological advancement and support clients in achieving their goals.


About the Role

At our clients company, data is at the heart of our transformation. Our Enterprise Data &
column2:
Analytics function is evolving into a Center of Expertise (CoE), delivering advanced analytics, automation, and machine learning solutions.‚Äã


We are seeking a Data Scientist / Analyst with robust technical skills to engineer, optimize, and promote our Dataiku (DSS) platform, utilized by both expert and citizen data scientists. This role combines hands-on data science with platform optimization and support responsibilities.‚Äã

If you're a problem-solver passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and proficient in tools like Python, Git, Terraform, and AWS, this opportunity is for you.‚Äã


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------


üîß Key Responsibilities

Data Science &
column3:
Platform Enablement

  • Design, build, and automate data workflows and analytics pipelines using Dataiku (DSS).‚Äã
  • Support internal teams and citizen data scientists in effective Dataiku utilization.‚Äã
  • Promote best practices in workflow structure, code quality, and governance.‚Äã

Platform Development &
column4:
Automation

  • Manage and enhance our AWS-hosted Dataiku platform.‚Äã
  • Develop and maintain automation pipelines, integrations, and reusable components.‚Äã
  • Monitor and refine platform usability and performance.‚Äã

Cross-Team Collaboration

  • Collaborate with cloud, infrastructure, MLOps, and data governance teams.‚Äã
  • Assist in deploying ML pipelines into production alongside data science teams.‚Äã
  • Work with support teams to resolve issues and improve user experience.‚Äã

Documentation &
column5:
Knowledge Sharing

  • Create comprehensive guides, documentation, and tutorials.‚Äã
  • Contribute to the development of an internal knowledge base on analytics and Dataiku usage.

‚Äã

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------


‚úÖQualifications

Must-Have

  • 3+ years in data science, analytics, or data platform roles.
  • Hands-on experience with Dataiku DSS.
  • Proficient in Python, with working knowledge of Git and Terraform.
  • Good understanding of AWS infrastructure and cloud deployments.
  • Comfortable with automation, platform monitoring, and support.

Nice-to-Have

  • Experience with MLOps, DevOps, or ML pipeline deployment.
  • Familiarity with platform governance and performance tuning.
  • Exposure to enterprise data environments and integration work.

Soft Skills

  • Clear communicator across technical and non-technical teams.
  • Problem-solver with a proactive mindset.
  • Team player with a drive to learn and improve.


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------


üéì Education

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.‚Äã


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Why Join Us?

  • Be part of a transformative journey in data utilization.
  • Collaborate with top-tier data teams and contribute to scaling a modern data science platform.‚Äã
  • Gain exposure to a diverse ecosystem of tools, projects, and business domains.‚Äã
  • Combine technical expertise with cross-functional impact in a dynamic, inclusive culture.


üîí Please note: ALTEN Belgium is only considering candidates who do not currently require a work permit and will not require one in the future to work in Belgium.

4190118008,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-at-dreamland-4190118008?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=UJ4FxOKQxSOgmYaIIPrcpg%3D%3D,Junior Data Analyst,DreamLand,"Beersel, Flemish Region, Belgium","Vacature omschrijving

Om ons datateam te versterken zijn we op zoek naar een gedreven data analyst die een cruciale rol zal spelen in het interpreteren en gebruiken van commerci√´le en financi√´le gegevens om inzichten te bieden aan het managementteam.
Opstellen en opvolgen van dashboards om de commerci√´le prestaties van de organisatie te monitoren, te analyseren en te visualiseren.
Maken van analyses en deep dives zowel proactief als op vraag. Op basis van de noden vanuit de business analyseer je de beschikbare informatie en vertaal je die in adviezen voor het managementteam.
Analyseren van verkoopgegevens, markttrends en klantgedrag om inzicht te krijgen in de prestaties van het assortiment en te komen tot een perfecte productmix.
Identificeren van kansen voor productuitbreiding en vernieuwing op basis van marktanalyse en klantbehoeften
Monitoren van voorraadniveaus en het optimaliseren van de voorraadrotatie.
Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een analytische en/of economische richting. Ook pas afgestudeerden zijn welkom.
Uitstekende kennis van Excel voor analyse en presentatie van gegevens.
Ervaring met opstellen van commerci√´le dashboards en rapporten is een extra troef.
Ervaring met SAP of vergelijkbare ERP-systemen is een pluspunt.
Sterke analytische vaardigheden en probleemoplossend vermogen.
Hands-on mentaliteit om het terrein te verkennen en sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.
Teamsfeer ‚Äì Reken op fijne collega‚Äôs die je steunen en met wie je samen plezier maakt.
Opleiding ‚Äì Je wordt opgeleid in je job en daarnaast hebben we een aanbod van opleidingen voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

Aantrekkelijk loonpakket ‚Äì Je krijgt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, extra verlofdagen en mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk.

Bij DreamLand kan je anders werken. Jij staat als mens centraal en dat merk je meteen. Zo kan je je vaardigheden scherpstellen dankzij onze ontwikkelingsgerichte aanpak en intern doorgroeien als je dat wilt. Of je nu analist, winkelmedewerker, marketeer of logistiek medewerker bent, bij ons vind je vast een job die perfect bij je past.

Vacature omschrijving

Om ons datateam te versterken zijn we op zoek naar een gedreven data analyst die een cruciale rol zal spelen in het interpreteren en gebruiken van commerci√´le en financi√´le gegevens om inzichten te bieden aan het managementteam.

Jouw Verantwoordelijkheden Omvatten Onder Meer

  • Opstellen en opvolgen van dashboards om de commerci√´le prestaties van de organisatie te monitoren, te analyseren en te visualiseren.
  • Maken van analyses en deep dives zowel proactief als op vraag. Op basis van de noden vanuit de business analyseer je de beschikbare informatie en vertaal je die in adviezen voor het managementteam.
  • Analyseren van verkoopgegevens, markttrends en klantgedrag om inzicht te krijgen in de prestaties van het assortiment en te komen tot een perfecte productmix.
  • Identificeren van kansen voor productuitbreiding en vernieuwing op basis van marktanalyse en klantbehoeften
  • Monitoren van voorraadniveaus en het optimaliseren van de voorraadrotatie.

Profiel

  • Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een analytische en/of economische richting. Ook pas afgestudeerden zijn welkom.
  • Uitstekende kennis van Excel voor analyse en presentatie van gegevens.
  • Ervaring met opstellen van commerci√´le dashboards en rapporten is een extra troef.
  • Ervaring met SAP of vergelijkbare ERP-systemen is een pluspunt.
  • Sterke analytische vaardigheden en probleemoplossend vermogen.
  • Hands-on mentaliteit om het terrein te verkennen en sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.

Wij bieden

  • Teamsfeer ‚Äì Reken op fijne collega‚Äôs die je steunen en met wie je samen plezier maakt.
  • Opleiding ‚Äì Je wordt opgeleid in je job en daarnaast hebben we een aanbod van opleidingen voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
  • Aantrekkelijk loonpakket ‚Äì Je krijgt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, extra verlofdagen en mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk.

Waarom werken bij DreamLand?

Bij DreamLand kan je anders werken. Jij staat als mens centraal en dat merk je meteen. Zo kan je je vaardigheden scherpstellen dankzij onze ontwikkelingsgerichte aanpak en intern doorgroeien als je dat wilt. Of je nu analist, winkelmedewerker, marketeer of logistiek medewerker bent, bij ons vind je vast een job die perfect bij je past.

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?
Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?
Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.
We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.
In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.
You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.
Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.
We Are Looking For Talent With The Following
Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis
Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English
The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals

An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers

Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients

If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

For more information, visit‚ÄØOgilvy.com, and follow us on LinkedIn,‚ÄØX,‚ÄØInstagram, and Facebook.

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels‚Äô WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices ‚Äì our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Unilever, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Lidl, Orange, EU and Belgian institutions, fueling their success locally & internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a ""lab‚Äù mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

Analyse social and digital data through a set of tools (Social Listening tools like Synthesio, Competitive Analysis tools like RivalIQ, Audience Analysis tools like Profiler or Global Web Index, Trends and Search Analysis tools like Semrush or Social Lab Proprietary Tools, etc.) based on a client briefing. Develop custom approaches leveraging available data sets and technologies to deliver on actionable insights to inform strategic recommendations.
Support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers, communities or creators are ‚Äòsaying‚Äô, ‚Äòsharing‚Äô and ‚Äòsearching‚Äô online.
Design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations.
Deliver high-quality service to local and international clients.
Participate in the creation of new, commercially viable data products.
Work with our clients and present the intelligence work.
Collaborate with WPP and external data providers.
A first experience in Social/Digital/Search Data Analytics, Insights and Digital/Social Strategy
Always-on social listening analysis and insights generation.
Cultural tracking (including trends) and insights generation for always-on and campaign use.
A strong understanding of today‚Äôs social media landscape and internet culture (Social 3.0, culture-first, community and creators led, audience-first) and new channels‚Äô codes.
A strong understanding of Social media performance metrics/KPIs for both organic and paid media.
You understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings and turn them into actionable insights
Eye for innovation and the next emerging platform or partner.
Comfortable using social and digital monitoring technologies such as Synthesio, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, etc.
Expert in the understanding of social media and established understanding of the wider digital communication landscape.
Ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team.
Fulltime opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels ‚Äì the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency ‚Äì Our words and promises produce actions.
As an Ogilvy Social.Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training and career conversations while doing strong work that works.

At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression.
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose - and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality.

Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve. This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.

Ogilvy is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

If you need any assistance seeking a job opportunity, or if you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at accommodations@ogilvy.com. Please note that this contact is only for candidates who are requesting accommodation. Emails for other purposes, including application status requests, will not receive a response.

About Ogilvy

Ogilvy has been creating impact for brands through iconic, culture-changing, value-driving ideas since the company was founded by David Ogilvy 75 years ago. It builds on that rich legacy through Borderless Creativity ‚Äì innovating at the intersections of its advertising, public relations, relationship design, consulting, and health capabilities with experts collaborating seamlessly across over 120 offices in nearly 90 countries. Ogilvy currently ranks as the #1 global agency network for creative excellence and effectiveness by WARC, signifying its ability to‚ÄØdeliver creative solutions that drive unreasonable impact for clients and communities.‚ÄØOgilvy is a WPP company (NYSE: WPP). For more information, visit‚ÄØOgilvy.com, and follow us on LinkedIn,‚ÄØX,‚ÄØInstagram, and Facebook.

4190173326,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/game-data-analyst-at-gameplay-galaxy-4190173326?position=28&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=wgetz4WrFcKZPzSp0j2PNQ%3D%3D,Game Data Analyst,Gameplay Galaxy,European Economic Area,"Department: Data

We are looking for a talented Game Data Analyst to join our dynamic analytics team. You'll work closely with game teams, using data to drive player retention, improve monetization strategies, and optimize user experience. If you‚Äôre excited by data and games, this is the role for you.
All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With
You‚Äôll collaborate with game development teams to analyze player behavior, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to drive game performance and player engagement.
You‚Äôll create dashboards and visualizations that support key business decisions by presenting clear and data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
You‚Äôll design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new game features and mechanics.
You‚Äôll work on projects related to the blockchain, analyzing how players engage with decentralized features and in-game economies.
You‚Äôll contribute to advanced analytics projects, including game economy analysis, to enhance monetization strategies and game progression.
You‚Äôll build out new ways to map in-game events, such as stunts, crashes, and progression to optimize player experience.
You‚Äôll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.
What You'll Bring To The Team
At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.
Why You'll Love Working With Us
We‚Äôre 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!

We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You‚Äôll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You‚Äôll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We are looking for a talented Game Data Analyst to join our dynamic analytics team. You'll work closely with game teams, using data to drive player retention, improve monetization strategies, and optimize user experience. If you‚Äôre excited by data and games, this is the role for you.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With

  • You‚Äôll collaborate with game development teams to analyze player behavior, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to drive game performance and player engagement.
  • You‚Äôll create dashboards and visualizations that support key business decisions by presenting clear and data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
  • You‚Äôll design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new game features and mechanics.
  • You‚Äôll work on projects related to the blockchain, analyzing how players engage with decentralized features and in-game economies.
  • You‚Äôll contribute to advanced analytics projects, including game economy analysis, to enhance monetization strategies and game progression.
  • You‚Äôll build out new ways to map in-game events, such as stunts, crashes, and progression to optimize player experience.
  • You‚Äôll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.

What You'll Bring To The Team

  • At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
  • Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
  • Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
  • Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
  • Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
  • A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
  • A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.

Why You'll Love Working With Us

  • We‚Äôre 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
  • We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
  • You‚Äôll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
  • You‚Äôll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
  • We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
  • We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
  • We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

4165278033,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analytics-lead-at-semetis-4165278033?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=5QK%2BF39cf9WxaR5T13fL4A%3D%3D,Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead,Semetis,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"üìÑ Type: Full-time | üìä Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)

At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.
Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.
4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn‚Äôt be offered.

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data‚Äîwe turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium‚Äôs leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.

This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn‚Äôt just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.
If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.
Full job description & application details here.
Ready to make an impact? Let‚Äôs talk.

column2:

Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data‚Äîwe turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium‚Äôs leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.


This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn‚Äôt just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. 4195458275,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-lending-data-analyst-at-ing-belgium-4195458275?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=YEJNDNEb18ZQoe598whQsw%3D%3D,Business Lending Data Analyst,ING Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Your role & work environment
As part of the development towards a ‚ÄúMore Digital- and Data driven Bank‚Äù, ING is renewing the data management capabilities globally.

As a data analyst in Business Lending, you work on a daily basis with (cross-border) colleagues having different expertise in self-steering feature teams (squads), contributing to the objectives of the tribe Business Lending which are supporting the business overall. These objectives are challenging, as regulatory and risk requirements are strengthening, client expectations are changing and there is a continuous pressure to increase efficiency. Within this context, you contribute to the design of an efficient and customer-oriented value proposition thanks to an extensive use of data analytics, but also including products and services, harmonized when possible between Belgium and the Netherlands. You will cover several customer segments from self-employed to mid-corporates.

Develop and automate Management Information reports (1) enabling the senior leaders to make appropriate decisions or (2) helping the bank to follow-up it‚Äôs compliancy against regulations or internal policies.
Translating the bank and tribe strategy to concrete initiatives within the scope of your squad
Analyzing the feasibility and the value of opportunities
Evaluating our way of working with the aim to continuously improve
Liaise with Customer Journey Experts to ensure reporting & data quality requirements are covered as from the design of the process.
Actively participating and taking initiative to improve the collaboration between different stakeholders and colleagues in other teams
Understanding and applying business principles and ensure compliancy with external regulation and internal minimum requirements

A colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a knack for always being a step ahead. In other words, you strive to bring fresh ideas to life and embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment. You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals. You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to propose creative solutions to problems.
As a Business Lending Data Analyst you will also need:
To be customer driven and focused, loving to collaborate with different people, ready to explore
An entrepreneurial attitude ‚Äì taking initiative and making things happen, manage and solve problems with the support of senior colleague
To act as process owner in the business lending domain with the support of a more senior colleague
To be interested in innovation in the domain, experiment by challenging existing trends, be curious
To manage projects involving one or 2 stakeholders with the support of a more senior colleague
affinity with data and good analytical skills, previous experience with data management/analysis
Knowledge of reporting software such as SAS Enteprise Guide, SAS Visual Analyics, PowerBI, Cognos, ‚Ä¶
Planning & organizational skills and ability to develop them with coaching
Clear communication skills : written and oral, be able to adapt your speech to the audience with the help of a more senior colleague
Previous experience in a (credit) risk oriented role is a plus
Knowledge of business lending products/services is recommended
Fluent in English and Dutch or French
Master degree or Bachelor degree with relevant work experience (e.g. Business Analyst, Data Analyst, .. )

4197243513,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-fsma-4197243513?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=YPZKXpxXDqB%2Fqigm6QRqYQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,FSMA,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?
Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô

The ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.
You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.
WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?
A Master‚Äôs degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2: a doctorate is an asset.

column1: Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.
A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.

A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.
Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?


Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô


WHERE WILL YOU BE WORKING?


The ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.


WHAT WILL YOUR JOB ENTAIL?


  • You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
  • You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
  • You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
  • You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.


WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?


  • A Master‚Äôs degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2:
a doctorate is an asset.
  • Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
  • Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
  • Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
  • An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
  • Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
  • Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
  • Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
  • Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
  • Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.


    • WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?


    • A full-time job with a permanent contract.
    • The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
    • A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
    • A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
    • Flexible working hours.
    • Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
    • Opportunities for internal mobility.
    • Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.


    Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).
Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs

Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?
You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English
column2: a good knowledge of Dutch is also required

column1: You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client‚Äôs request

4200129785,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/commercial-data-analyst-at-luminus-4200129785?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=PXjYoVCyrDqGWbW07TcBog%3D%3D,Commercial Data Analyst,Luminus,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Publication date: April 3, 2025

Become a key part of our Data Analysis team in the Retail & B2B department and help shape Luminus' vision with data-driven insights. Your skills in SQL, SAS, and Qlik will be essential for analyzing large datasets to reveal trends and patterns that enhance retail operations and improve the customer experience.
You develop and maintain advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
You generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
You maintain close relationships with business stakeholders and acquire detailed knowledge of business processes.
You collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
You respond to ad-hoc data requests and support day-to-day operations with timely data analysis.
You drive continuous improvement in retail processes through proactive data insights and innovations.
You present data-driven recommendations to management and aid in the decision-making process.
You hold an MSc degree in a business, data, or technology-related field, or have equivalent experience.
You have expert knowledge of SQL. You are highly skilled in data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R.
You also have knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik.
You have a strong analytical mindset with a keen attention to detail.
You are agile and results-focused, with a work ethic that drives success.
You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
You possess excellent communication skills in English and are proficient in Dutch or French.
Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

Publication date: April 3, 2025

Brussels

Contract open-end

Become a key part of our Data Analysis team in the Retail &
column2:
B2B department and help shape Luminus' vision with data-driven insights. Your skills in SQL, SAS, and Qlik will be essential for analyzing large datasets to reveal trends and patterns that enhance retail operations and improve the customer experience.

Your Daily Job

  • You develop and maintain advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
  • You generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
  • You maintain close relationships with business stakeholders and acquire detailed knowledge of business processes.
  • You collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
  • You respond to ad-hoc data requests and support day-to-day operations with timely data analysis.
  • You drive continuous improvement in retail processes through proactive data insights and innovations.
  • You present data-driven recommendations to management and aid in the decision-making process.

Your Profile

  • You hold an MSc degree in a business, data, or technology-related field, or have equivalent experience.
  • You have expert knowledge of SQL. You are highly skilled in data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R.
  • You also have knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik.
  • You have a strong analytical mindset with a keen attention to detail.
  • You are agile and results-focused, with a work ethic that drives success.
  • You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
  • You possess excellent communication skills in English and are proficient in Dutch or French.

BPMN).
