Welcome to Sansaone, a dynamic force in the realm of ICT talent acquisition. Born out of a passion for excellence and a vision for connecting outstanding professionals with forward-thinking organizations, we stand as a beacon for strategic recruitment solutions in the Information and Communication Technology sector. With a commitment to excellence and a passion for connecting exceptional professionals with innovative organizations, we are your strategic partner in building transformative teams.
We currently have a vacancy for a Data Engineer fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert in Valletta, Malta.

The work will be carried out either remotely or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client‚Äôs IT team on site.
Design, develop, document, and maintain ETL/ELT processes, data integration, cleaning, transformation, dissemination and automation processes.
Design, develop, document and maintain data architecture, data modelling and metadata.
Develop and support data warehouse/lakehouse architectures and data processing ensuring data quality, lineage, auditing, metadata, logging, linkage across datasets and impact assessments.
Develop and maintain business intelligence models, interactive dashboards, reports and analytics using tools such as Databricks, Jupyter Notebooks, and Power BI.
Design, develop, document, improve and maintain the Data Warehouse/Lakehouse ecosystem (e.g. the DataDevOps lifecycle, architecture).
Contribute to the definition and documentation of data governance policies, procedures, standards, and metadata models.
University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 6 years of relevant working experience in IT.
Experience with development and data processing using e.g. Python, SQL, Power M and DAX.
Experience with structured, semi-structured and unstructured data types and related file format (e.g. JSON, Parquet, Delta).
Experience with gathering business requirements and transforming it into data collection, integration and analysis processes.

Experience in Microsoft On-Prem and Azure Data Platform tools (such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, SQL Server, ADLS, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric/Power BI, Azure DevOps, Azure AI Services, PowerShell).
Experience in CI/CD lifecycle using Azure DevOps.
Experience in Databricks ecosystem, Apache Spark and Python data processing libraries.
Experience with Data Modelling principles and methods.
Experience with Data Lakes and Data Lakehouse architecture, concepts and governance.
Experience with Data Integration and data warehouse/lakehouse modelling techniques, concepts and methods (e.g. SCD, Functional Engineering, Data Vault, Data Streaming, etc).
Experience with data governance and data management standards, policies, processes, metadata, quality, etc.
Experience with WebAPIs and OpenAPI standard.
Knowledge of DAMA Data Management best practices and standards.
Knowledge of Data Governance and Discovery tools such as Azure Purview.
Knowledge of Master data and reference data management concepts.
Knowledge of Business glossaries, data dictionaries, and data catalogues.
Knowledge of Moodle or other Learning Management System.
Excellent command of the English language.

Job Description

Welcome to Sansaone, a dynamic force in the realm of ICT talent acquisition. Born out of a passion for excellence and a vision for connecting outstanding professionals with forward-thinking organizations, we stand as a beacon for strategic recruitment solutions in the Information and Communication Technology sector. With a commitment to excellence and a passion for connecting exceptional professionals with innovative organizations, we are your strategic partner in building transformative teams.

We currently have a vacancy for a Data Engineer fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert in Valletta, Malta.

  • The work will be carried out either remotely or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client‚Äôs IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • Design, develop, document, and maintain ETL/ELT processes, data integration, cleaning, transformation, dissemination and automation processes.
  • Design, develop, document and maintain data architecture, data modelling and metadata.
  • Develop and support data warehouse/lakehouse architectures and data processing ensuring data quality, lineage, auditing, metadata, logging, linkage across datasets and impact assessments.
  • Develop and maintain business intelligence models, interactive dashboards, reports and analytics using tools such as Databricks, Jupyter Notebooks, and Power BI.
  • Design, develop, document, improve and maintain the Data Warehouse/Lakehouse ecosystem (e.g. the DataDevOps lifecycle, architecture).
  • Contribute to the definition and documentation of data governance policies, procedures, standards, and metadata models.

Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 6 years of relevant working experience in IT.
  • Experience with development and data processing using e.g. Python, SQL, Power M and DAX.
  • Experience with structured, semi-structured and unstructured data types and related file format (e.g. JSON, Parquet, Delta).
  • Experience with gathering business requirements and transforming it into data collection, integration and analysis processes.
  • Experience in Microsoft On-Prem and Azure Data Platform tools (such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, SQL Server, ADLS, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric/Power BI, Azure DevOps, Azure AI Services, PowerShell).
  • Experience in CI/CD lifecycle using Azure DevOps.
  • Experience in Databricks ecosystem, Apache Spark and Python data processing libraries.
  • Experience with Data Modelling principles and methods.
  • Experience with Data Lakes and Data Lakehouse architecture, concepts and governance.
  • Experience with Data Integration and data warehouse/lakehouse modelling techniques, concepts and methods (e.g. SCD, Functional Engineering, Data Vault, Data Streaming, etc).
  • Experience with data governance and data management standards, policies, processes, metadata, quality, etc.
  • Experience with WebAPIs and OpenAPI standard.
  • Knowledge of DAMA Data Management best practices and standards.
  • Knowledge of Data Governance and Discovery tools such as Azure Purview.
  • Knowledge of Master data and reference data management concepts.
  • Knowledge of Business glossaries, data dictionaries, and data catalogues.
  • Knowledge of Moodle or other Learning Management System.
  • Excellent command of the English language.

Hiring Team Member

Avula Srivalli

Recruitment Coordinator

4198729449,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/statistical-computing-support-specialist-at-hyper-recruitment-solutions-4198729449?position=10&pageNum=10&refId=fWRyTsR9Ji2bh05F0jDY9w%3D%3D&trackingId=O%2FGy9wHQaupXgm1LrfWGDA%3D%3D,Statistical Computing Support Specialist,Hyper Recruitment Solutions,"Brussels Region, Belgium","A leading company in the Pharmaceutical industry, based in Brussels, Belgium, is recruiting a Statistical Computing Support Specialist to join their team. As the Statistical Computing Support Specialist, you will be responsible for focusing on statistical computing environments. The aim is to alleviate operational tasks from internal staff, allowing them to concentrate on managerial responsibilities.
This is a mission until the end of December 2025, with possible extension and can offer flexible working with some site presence in Brussels.
The rate on offer is a maximum of 75-80 eur per hour, 40 hours per week, however 30 hours per week can be considered as well. English language is a must.
Your duties as the Statistical Computing Support Specialist will be varied however the key duties and responsibilities are as follows:
As the Statistical Computing Support Specialist, you will assist in setting up, migrating, and supporting statistical computing environments.
As the Statistical Computing Support Specialist, you will collaborate with internal teams to ensure the seamless integration of new systems for analyzing clinical study data.
As the Statistical Computing Support Specialist, you will utilize Agile methodologies to manage and execute project tasks effectively.
As the Statistical Computing Support Specialist, you will communicate and collaborate efficiently in a hybrid or remote work setup.
To be successful in your application to this exciting role as the Statistical Computing Support Specialist we are looking to identify the following on your profile and past history:
Relevant degree in a related field such as Computer Science, Statistics, or Pharmaceuticals.
Proven industry experience in supporting statistical computing environments like SAS or R.
A working knowledge and practical experience with pharmaceutical data workflows and secure data handling.
Key Words: Statistical Computing / SAS / R / Pharmaceutical Systems / Clinical Data Analysis / Agile Methodologies / Data Migration / Remote Work / Belgium / Statistical Support

Hyper Recruitment Solutions Ltd (HRS) is an Equal Opportunities employer. We welcome applications from anyone who meets the role requirements. HRS exclusively supports the Life Science sectors, combining recruitment expertise with scientific knowledge to help you advance your career.

A leading company in the Pharmaceutical industry, based in Brussels, Belgium, is recruiting a Statistical Computing Support Specialist to join their team. As the Statistical Computing Support Specialist, you will be responsible for focusing on statistical computing environments. The aim is to alleviate operational tasks from internal staff, allowing them to concentrate on managerial responsibilities.

This is a mission until the end of December 2025, with possible extension and can offer flexible working with some site presence in Brussels.

The rate on offer is a maximum of 75-80 eur per hour, 40 hours per week, however 30 hours per week can be considered as well. English language is a must.

Key Duties And Responsibilities

Your duties as the Statistical Computing Support Specialist will be varied however the key duties and responsibilities are as follows:

  • As the Statistical Computing Support Specialist, you will assist in setting up, migrating, and supporting statistical computing environments.
  • As the Statistical Computing Support Specialist, you will collaborate with internal teams to ensure the seamless integration of new systems for analyzing clinical study data.
  • As the Statistical Computing Support Specialist, you will utilize Agile methodologies to manage and execute project tasks effectively.
  • As the Statistical Computing Support Specialist, you will communicate and collaborate efficiently in a hybrid or remote work setup.

Role Requirements

To be successful in your application to this exciting role as the Statistical Computing Support Specialist we are looking to identify the following on your profile and past history:

  • Relevant degree in a related field such as Computer Science, Statistics, or Pharmaceuticals.
  • Proven industry experience in supporting statistical computing environments like SAS or R.
  • A working knowledge and practical experience with pharmaceutical data workflows and secure data handling.

Key Words: Statistical Computing / SAS / R / Pharmaceutical Systems / Clinical Data Analysis / Agile Methodologies / Data Migration / Remote Work / Belgium / Statistical Support

Hyper Recruitment Solutions Ltd (HRS) is an Equal Opportunities employer. We welcome applications from anyone who meets the role requirements. HRS exclusively supports the Life Science sectors, combining recruitment expertise with scientific knowledge to help you advance your career.

Job Description

Ypto is op zoek naar gemotiveerde jonge afgestudeerden die de kloof tussen IT en business willen overbruggen. We zijn op zoek naar verschillende profielen, waaronder functionele analisten, ontwikkelaars, testers en data engineers, elk met hun eigen vaardigheden en verantwoordelijkheden.

Je maakt deel uit van onze Solution Delivery Transport Operations, Data &
column2: Planning (TDP) afdeling, die verantwoordelijk is voor systemen die real-time operaties ondersteunen, transportuitvoeringsbeheer, transportplanning, competentiebeheer, data &
column3:
analytics, M365, samenwerkingshulpmiddelen en documentbeheer.

Verantwoordelijkheden

Functionele Analisten:

  • Identificeren en analyseren van klantbehoeften.
  • Vertalen van zakelijke behoeften naar IT-oplossingen.
  • Uitvoeren van gedetailleerde bedrijfsprocesanalyse en optimalisatie.
  • Faciliteren van de communicatie tussen business units en technische teams.
  • Documenteren en effectief communiceren van vereisten naar alle belanghebbenden.
  • Gebruik maken van de Atlassian suite (JIRA, Confluence) en werken volgens de Agile/Scrum-methodologie.

Ontwikkelaars

  • Ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en implementeren van IT-oplossingen op basis van vereisten.
  • Deelnemen aan verschillende fasen van de softwareontwikkelingscyclus.
  • Fouten opsporen, testen en onderhouden van softwareapplicaties.
  • Zorgen voor hoogwaardig en effici√´nt geschreven code.
  • Samenwerken met Functionele Analisten en implementatiepartners om een naadloze integratie van oplossingen te garanderen.

Testers

  • Ontwikkelen en uitvoeren van testplannen om de softwarekwaliteit en functionaliteit te waarborgen.
  • Identificeren, documenteren en volgen van softwarefouten, inconsistenties en potenti√´le verbeterpunten.
  • Nauw samenwerken met ontwikkelaars en andere belanghebbenden om problemen op te lossen en de productkwaliteit te verbeteren.
  • Grondige regressietests uitvoeren om defecten te verifi√´ren en ervoor te zorgen dat er geen nieuwe problemen worden ge√Øntroduceerd.
  • Werken met automatiseringstools om de effici√´ntie en dekking van tests te verbeteren.

Data Engineers

  • Ontwikkelen van end-to-end data-applicaties met behulp van Azure-diensten.
  • Werken met Azure data-analysetools (Data Factory, Synapse, SQL Server, Databricks, Azure ML).
  • Zich vertrouwd maken met open-source datatechnologie√´n (PySpark, Pandas, SQL).
  • Kennismaken met en het toepassen van de nieuwste best practices en tools voor software-engineering (Git, CI/CD, tests, Pipelines, Bitbucket, Azure DevOps).
  • Samenwerken met functionele analisten om ervoor te zorgen dat de data-applicaties aan alle vereisten voldoen.
  • Zelfstandig werken, meerdere belanghebbenden en taken prioriteren en de werktijd effectief beheren.
  • Deelnemen aan de definitie van standaarden, richtlijnen en best practices en ervoor zorgen dat deze nageleefd worden.
  • Professioneel groeien, op de hoogte blijven van de laatste trends en technologie√´n en de potenti√´le impact van markttrends op jouw taken identificeren.

Job Requirements

Een afgeronde master in een relevant vakgebied zoals:

  • Ingenieurswetenschappen
  • Economie
  • Commerci√´le Wetenschappen
  • Financi√´n
  • IT/Technologie
  • Passie voor technologie.
  • Eagerness om te leren en ambitie.
  • Snel kunnen aanpassen aan nieuwe concepten.
  • Een internationale mindset.
  • Sterke teamspeler met de motto ""Together everyone achieves more"".
  • In staat zijn om ten minste 2 dagen per week op kantoor te werken en op aanvraag tot 5 dagen per week.

Aanvullende Vereisten Voor Functionele Analisten

  • Sterke analytische vaardigheden om bedrijfsproblemen diepgaand te begrijpen.
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden om de interactie tussen business en technische teams te faciliteren.
  • Vaardigheid in bedrijfsprocesanalyse en optimalisatie.
  • Ervaring met de Atlassian suite (JIRA, Confluence) en de Agile/Scrum-methodologie.
  • Uitstekende kennis van het Nederlands of Frans, en het vermogen om de andere taal te begrijpen. Kennis van Engels is ook vereist.

Aanvullende Vereisten Voor Ontwikkelaars

  • Een afgeronde master in IT/Technologie of een verwante discipline.
  • Vaardigheid in programmeertalen en tools zoals C#/.Net, Kubernetes, Azure Function, Service Bus, CosmosDB, Redis Cache, Application Insights, React en Blazor.
  • Ervaring in softwareontwikkeling en een goed begrip van de softwareontwikkelingscyclus.

Aanvullende Vereisten Voor Testers

  • Vaardigheid in testprocessen, van vereistenanalyse tot de uitvoering van het testplan.
  • Beheersing van het Engels.

Aanvullende Vereisten Voor Data Engineers

  • Een STEM-achtergrond (wetenschap, technologie, engineering, wiskunde of gelijkwaardig).
  • Passie voor technologie.
  • Een analytische geest, die de voorkeur geeft aan grondig onderzoek van zakelijke vereisten en uitgebreide analyse totdat het probleem volledig is begrepen.
  • Bereidheid om te leren en ambitie.
  • Snelle aanpassing aan nieuwe concepten.
  • Kennis van Engels en Frans/Nederlands (bij voorkeur alle drie).

  • Maaltijd- en ecocheques.

Met Extra Voordelen

  • Een fantastische groeipad binnen IT, op maat van jouw ambities en interesses.
  • On-the-job training en toegang tot zowel interne als externe cursussen.
  • Blootstelling aan complexe, uitdagende en innovatieve projecten.
  • Mogelijkheden om te werken met state-of-the-art technologie√´n en -tools.

bpost strives to create an inclusive environment with challenging projects and inspiring collaborations. With our employees at the heart of our organization, we don‚Äôt believe in jobs, we believe in careers. We're now looking for a Financial Analyst who will help us connect people and society.

As a Financial Analyst, your role is to provide in-depth financial analysis and insights to support decision-making. You will work closely with business stakeholders to ensure financial performance tracking, market analysis, and optimization strategies.
Analyze financial and operational data to support strategic decisions.
Develop financial models and forecasts to evaluate business performance.
Conduct in-depth market research to identify new opportunities.
Provide data-driven recommendations to improve profitability and efficiency.
Work closely with marketing, operations, and product teams to assess financial impact.
Monitor key financial KPIs and report insights to senior management.
Support budgeting and financial planning activities.
Ensure compliance with internal financial policies and external regulations.
Experience in financial analysis, business intelligence, or market research.
Ability to synthesize data from multiple sources into actionable insights.
Fluent in French or Dutch, with a strong command of English.
A phone subscription and company car.
20 days of statutory leave and 7 additional extra-legal days off.
End-of-year and performance-based bonuses, plus double holiday pay.

bpost is Belgium‚Äôs leading postal operator and, as part of bpostgroup, we are a growing parcel & omni-commerce logistics partner worldwide. With a strong commitment to social and environmental sustainability, we aim to be a trusted guide in a changing world.
Become part of #thebiggestteamofBelgium with a unique atmosphere and culture.
Enjoy a dynamic work environment with a flexible hybrid model.
Have access to continuous learning and development opportunities.
Directly impact decision-making in an international success story.
Thrive in a leadership culture focused on vision, innovation, and empowerment.

Financial Analyst

bpost strives to create an inclusive environment with challenging projects and inspiring collaborations. With our employees at the heart of our organization, we don‚Äôt believe in jobs, we believe in careers. We're now looking for a Financial Analyst who will help us connect people and society.

Your Mission

As a Financial Analyst, your role is to provide in-depth financial analysis and insights to support decision-making. You will work closely with business stakeholders to ensure financial performance tracking, market analysis, and optimization strategies.

Your Responsibilities

  • Analyze financial and operational data to support strategic decisions.
  • Develop financial models and forecasts to evaluate business performance.
  • Conduct in-depth market research to identify new opportunities.
  • Provide data-driven recommendations to improve profitability and efficiency.
  • Work closely with marketing, operations, and product teams to assess financial impact.
  • Monitor key financial KPIs and report insights to senior management.
  • Support budgeting and financial planning activities.
  • Ensure compliance with internal financial policies and external regulations.

Your Profile

  • Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Experience in financial analysis, business intelligence, or market research.
  • Ability to synthesize data from multiple sources into actionable insights.
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills.
  • Fluent in French or Dutch, with a strong command of English.

Our Offer

  • Competitive monthly salary.
  • Meal vouchers.
  • Hospitalization, group, and disability insurances.
  • A phone subscription and company car.
  • 20 days of statutory leave and 7 additional extra-legal days off.
  • End-of-year and performance-based bonuses, plus double holiday pay.
  • Benefits from over 100 bpost partners.

About Bpost

bpost is Belgium‚Äôs leading postal operator and, as part of bpostgroup, we are a growing parcel &

A major player in the IT sector, we have continued to grow and evolve since our creation in 1993. With a dedicated team of nearly 2.000 employees spread across several sites in Wallonia and Brussels, NSI has followed an exceptional trajectory. Our company is at the forefront of the digital revolution, offering a complete range of IT services, from analysis and software development to architecture and IT governance.


Your role at NSI

As a Functional/Technical Analyst, you will join NSI in the Talent Services Business Unit and work as part of our client's team in Brussels.


Your job will involve :

  • Translating customer/business needs into detailed functional analyses
  • Translates functional analysis into technical requirements ready for implementation by developers
  • Estimate of the workload required to achieve functionality in collaboration with other stakeholders
  • Review and analysis of ""requests for change""
  • Analysis of the impact of proposed solutions
  • Description of test scenarios, preparation of test data and organization of test execution in close cooperation with the Test Coordinator.
  • Documentation


This function is for you because

You are familiar with the following technologies :

  • Minimum 5 years of experience as a Functional/Technical Analyst
  • Previous experience as a developer is welcome
  • Strong knowledge of UML and BPMN
  • Experience in O.O. development (Java or .NET environment)
  • Work permit in Belgium
  • Fluent in French or Dutch and a very good understanding of the other language as well as English

but also, you are familiar with the following technologies :

  • Scrum/Agile
  • Webservices REST, SOAP, Open API
  • XSD, XML, YAML, XSLT, XPATH, XQUERY
  • SQL (queries,..)
  • Jira, Confluence
  • Waterfall methodology (Prince2, PMI,...) is a plus


Bonus

ü´¥ You're a multitasking person and ready to invest in a rewarding role

üë´ Working as part of a team and collaborating with your colleagues is essential to you

4194996470,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/strategic-process-analyst-%E2%80%93-v-i-e-programme-at-eurofins-4194996470?position=10&pageNum=12&refId=0%2FRzbovc7Py%2By7CWArdknA%3D%3D&trackingId=JTJUpRFkS%2BWo8sB0YVPdPA%3D%3D,Strategic Process Analyst ‚Äì V.I.E Programme,Eurofins,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic, and labelling is accurate.

Eurofins is dedicated to delivering testing services that contribute to the health and safety of society and the planet, and to its corporate responsibility to protect the environment and ensure diversity, equity, and inclusion across the entire network of Eurofins companies.
As a Strategic Process Analyst, you will work on improving key processes within the scope of the Group Chief Financial Officer. In your role, you will:
Conduct analyses: Collect and process data while upholding quality standards
column2: conduct in-depth analysis of existing processes to identify potential issues and opportunities for improvement.

column1: Drive continuous improvement: Design and document standardised target processes and methodologies
column2: ensure their deployment (driving implementation of tools, systems and processes) to align with business goals and best practices.

column1: Coordinate initiatives: Work closely with support teams, delivery managers, product managers, functional analysts and development teams to understand and identify solutions.

Lead change adoption and manage different stakeholders: For each project, support change management efforts, including stakeholder alignment, communication plans, and training programmes to ensure successful deployment
Manage different projects: Be responsible for project sponsors, planning, actions and milestones, always proactively communicating critical issues.
Please note that V.I.E contracts are only applicable to European Economic Area (EEA) citizens who are between 18 and 28 years old. The position is based in Brussels, Belgium.
Learn more about V.I.E roles here: https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en
Education and experience: Master‚Äôs degree in sciences, engineering, business, or a related field.
Language proficiency: Fluent in English (oral and written)
column2: additional languages are a plus.

column1: Technical skills: Knowledge of Microsoft Office tools is required along with proficiency in data analysis, data visualisation, and reporting tools.
Personal skills: Strong interpersonal skills (e.g. oral and written communication, presentation skills)
column2: highly motivated to understand and improve complex processes
column3: ability to define concepts and describe them clearly and concisely
column4: organisational skills with high attention-to-detail
column5: highly proactive and autonomous.

column1: We support your development! Do you feel you don‚Äôt match 100% of the requirements? Don‚Äôt hesitate to apply anyway! Eurofins companies are committed to supporting your career development.

We‚ÄØembrace‚ÄØdiversity!‚ÄØ As an Equal Opportunity Employer, the Eurofins network of companies believes in strength and innovation through diversity. We prohibit discrimination against employees or applications based on gender identity and/or expression, race, nationality, age, religion, sexual orientation, disability, and everything else that makes employees of Eurofins companies unique.

Sustainability matters to us!‚ÄØ‚ÄØWe are well on our way to achieving our objective of carbon neutrality by 2025, through a combination of emission reduction and compensation initiatives. We encourage our laboratory leaders to make sustainable changes at their local level, and in addition to their initiatives we count on our dedicated carbon reduction team to help us to achieve this goal!
Find out more on our Careers page:‚ÄØhttps://careers.eurofins.com/

Company description:‚ÄØEurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate.

The Eurofins network of companies believes that it is a global leader in food, environment, pharmaceutical and cosmetic product testing and in discovery pharmacology, forensics, advanced material sciences and agroscience contract research services. It is also one of the market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, and in the support of clinical studies, as well as in biopharma contract development and manufacturing. It also has a rapidly developing presence in highly specialised and molecular clinical diagnostic testing and in-vitro diagnostic products.

In over 37 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to ca. 63,000 staff across a decentralised and entrepreneurial network of more than 950 laboratories in over 1,000 companies across 60 countries. Eurofins companies offer a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products.
In 2024, Eurofins generated total revenues of EUR 6.95 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.

Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic, and labelling is accurate.

Eurofins is dedicated to delivering testing services that contribute to the health and safety of society and the planet, and to its corporate responsibility to protect the environment and ensure diversity, equity, and inclusion across the entire network of Eurofins companies.



Job Description

As a Strategic Process Analyst, you will work on improving key processes within the scope of the Group Chief Financial Officer. In your role, you will:

Conduct analyses: Collect and process data while upholding quality standards
column2:
conduct in-depth analysis of existing processes to identify potential issues and opportunities for improvement.

Drive continuous improvement: Design and document standardised target processes and methodologies
column3:
ensure their deployment (driving implementation of tools, systems and processes) to align with business goals and best practices.

Coordinate initiatives: Work closely with support teams, delivery managers, product managers, functional analysts and development teams to understand and identify solutions.

Lead change adoption and manage different stakeholders: For each project, support change management efforts, including stakeholder alignment, communication plans, and training programmes to ensure successful deployment

Manage different projects: Be responsible for project sponsors, planning, actions and milestones, always proactively communicating critical issues.

Please note that V.I.E contracts are only applicable to European Economic Area (EEA) citizens who are between 18 and 28 years old. The position is based in Brussels, Belgium.

Starting date: June - July 2025

Duration of the contract: 12 months.

Learn more about V.I.E roles here: https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en



Qualifications

Education and experience: Master‚Äôs degree in sciences, engineering, business, or a related field.

Language proficiency: Fluent in English (oral and written)
column4:
additional languages are a plus.

Technical skills: Knowledge of Microsoft Office tools is required along with proficiency in data analysis, data visualisation, and reporting tools.

Personal skills: Strong interpersonal skills (e.g. oral and written communication, presentation skills)
column5: highly motivated to understand and improve complex processes
column6: ability to define concepts and describe them clearly and concisely
column7: organisational skills with high attention-to-detail
column8:
highly proactive and autonomous.



Additional Information

We support your development! Do you feel you don‚Äôt match 100% of the requirements? Don‚Äôt hesitate to apply anyway! Eurofins companies are committed to supporting your career development.

We prohibit discrimination against employees or applications based on gender identity and/or expression, race, nationality, age, religion, sexual orientation, disability, and everything else that makes employees of Eurofins companies unique.

Sustainability matters to us!‚ÄØ‚ÄØWe are well on our way to achieving our objective of carbon neutrality by 2025, through a combination of emission reduction and compensation initiatives. We encourage our laboratory leaders to make sustainable changes at their local level, and in addition to their initiatives we count on our dedicated carbon reduction team to help us to achieve this goal!

Find out more on our Careers page:‚ÄØhttps://careers.eurofins.com/

Company description:‚ÄØEurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate.

The Eurofins network of companies believes that it is a global leader in food, environment, pharmaceutical and cosmetic product testing and in discovery pharmacology, forensics, advanced material sciences and agroscience contract research services. It is also one of the market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, and in the support of clinical studies, as well as in biopharma contract development and manufacturing. It also has a rapidly developing presence in highly specialised and molecular clinical diagnostic testing and in-vitro diagnostic products.

In over 37 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to ca. 63,000 staff across a decentralised and entrepreneurial network of more than 950 laboratories in over 1,000 companies across 60 countries. Eurofins companies offer a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products.

In 2024, Eurofins generated total revenues of EUR 6.95 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.

Als IT Custodian ben jij een sleutelfiguur in het Data Platform-team en verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling, implementatie en optimalisatie van een holistisch Modern Data Platform in de Microsoft Azure Cloud.

Al meer dan 90 jaar zorgt de Nationale Loterij voor veilig speelplezier voor alle Belgen ouder dan 18 jaar. Door het vertrouwen van al haar spelers staat de Nationale Loterij sterk: op die manier wist ze in 2024 een omzet te boeken van 1,533 miljard euro. Dankzij de kleine inzetbedragen van veel spelers kan de Nationale Loterij elk jaar zomaar eventjes 345 miljoen euro laten terugvloeien naar de Belgische samenleving. Talrijke projecten en verenigingen die voor de samenleving nuttig zijn, krijgen op die manier de steun die ze nodig hebben om het verschil te maken.

De Afdeling IT is niets meer en niets minder dan het kloppend hart van de Nationale Loterij, want ze werkt nauw samen met de voltallige organisatie om de spelers zeven dagen op zeven de best mogelijke speelervaring aan te bieden binnen een beveiligde omgeving. En die samenwerking dient ook om de onberispelijke reputatie van de Nationale Loterij in stand te houden. Wie rekent op een dergelijke ingesteldheid? Onze miljoenen spelers, onze talloze winnaars en de ontelbare ""goede doelen"" die we iedere dag opnieuw voor meer dan 520.000 euro steunen!

Wij zoeken een Azure Date Engineer. Als IT Custodian ben jij een sleutelfiguur in het Data Platform-team en verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling, implementatie en optimalisatie van een holistisch Modern Data Platform in de Microsoft Azure Cloud.

About

4057291125,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-brussels-at-capgemini-4057291125?position=5&pageNum=15&refId=KoJ9x%2FrPrnamnjr6F2oPtQ%3D%3D&trackingId=uSSQH5tAIp8Zbz3yNRz3ew%3D%3D,Data Engineer (Brussels),Capgemini,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","As Stephen Few states: ‚ÄúWe are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven't learned how to tame it.‚Äù Capgemini Insights & Data is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.
We are looking for a Data Engineer to help our clients in their digital transformations.
Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems
Ensure data pipelines and data stores are high-performing, efficient, organized, and reliable, given a set of business requirements and constraints
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design
One more more leading Data platforms: Azure, Databricks, Snowflake, Google Cloud Platform and it's infra and CI/CD context
Microsoft Fabric, Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure SQL database, Azure Devops, Azure Analysis Services, ...
Keen understanding of Data Modeling methodologies (Kimball, Data Vault 2.0)
Knowledge of Lakehouse principles and medallion architecture
Expert knowledge of SQL and T-SQL or DBT
Fluent in Dutch with professional working proficiency in English
DP-203: Data Engineering on Microsoft Azure
WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE?

At Capgemini Belgium we offer flexibility in more than one way: next to our hybrid way of working, where we offer you can work 70% from home, we also offer our flex abroad program. With this program you can work up to 45 days abroad, this to maintain a good work-life balance.
Next To This We Also Offer Following Additional Benefits
Company car or mobility budget (whatever works best for you)
A flex plan where you can buy extra days off, update your insurance or buy home office supplies.
Get the future you want | www.capgemini.com

column2:
Data is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to help our clients in their digital transformations.

YOUR ROLE

  • Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems
  • Ensure data pipelines and data stores are high-performing, efficient, organized, and reliable, given a set of business requirements and constraints
  • Create and design data models
  • Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design


YOUR PROFILE

  • One more more leading Data platforms: Azure, Databricks, Snowflake, Google Cloud Platform and it's infra and CI/CD context
  • Microsoft Fabric, Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure SQL database, Azure Devops, Azure Analysis Services, ...
  • Databricks
  • Snowflake, Snowpipe, Snowflake Native Apps, ...
  • Keen understanding of Data Modeling methodologies (Kimball, Data Vault 2.0)
  • Knowledge of Lakehouse principles and medallion architecture
  • Expert knowledge of SQL and T-SQL or DBT
  • Fluent in Dutch with professional working proficiency in English


Relevant certificates

  • DP-203: Data Engineering on Microsoft Azure
  • Snowpro core/advanced
  • Databricks Lakehouse Professional


WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE?

At Capgemini Belgium we offer flexibility in more than one way: next to our hybrid way of working, where we offer you can work 70% from home, we also offer our flex abroad program. With this program you can work up to 45 days abroad, this to maintain a good work-life balance.

Next To This We Also Offer Following Additional Benefits

  • Net expenses
  • Company car or mobility budget (whatever works best for you)
  • Health insurance
  • Meal vouchers
  • Pension plan
  • Eco vouchers from ‚Ç¨250/year.
  • A flex plan where you can buy extra days off, update your insurance or buy home office supplies.
  • 32 vacation days + Bank holidays.


Get the future you want | www.capgemini.com

Apply now!

4204332857,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/database-engineer-at-keystone-solutions-4204332857?position=6&pageNum=15&refId=KoJ9x%2FrPrnamnjr6F2oPtQ%3D%3D&trackingId=focw80jdpcklQFMC3SiBSQ%3D%3D,Database Engineer,Keystone Solutions,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Mission Overview:

As a Database Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, management, and optimization of database management systems at client sites through Keystone Solutions. Your main responsibilities will include:
Participating in the design and modeling of databases in collaboration with development teams.
Developing efficient, standardized database schemas that meet application needs.
Installing, configuring, and maintaining database management systems (DBMS) such as MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server, etc.
Ensuring availability, security, and integrity of data stored in databases.
Monitoring database performance and implementing adjustments to ensure rapid response to queries.
Collaborating with development teams to optimize queries and enhance overall system performance.
Implementing robust security mechanisms to protect sensitive data.
Managing access rights to databases and ensuring compliance with security standards.
Developing effective backup strategies and ensuring data recovery in case of incidents.
Regularly testing backup and recovery procedures.
Maintaining comprehensive documentation of databases, including structure, stored procedures, and configurations.
Training users and team members on the efficient use of databases.
Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field.
In-depth knowledge of MS-SQL database software, including writing SQL queries, performance optimization, data migration, and scheduling management.
Knowledge of Oracle and Sybase is a plus.
Basic skills in server management (Windows and Linux), hypervisors (vmWare, XenServer), and storage units.
Good knowledge of Windows and/or Linux OS and some knowledge of Middleware (optional).
Ability to work independently and effectively collaborate within a team.
Ability to actively and effectively participate in conversations in English.
Demonstrating strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Willingness to participate in on-call duties and support roles.
If you are ready to tackle technical and strategic challenges in a dynamic consultancy environment, apply today at Keystone Solutions Career Portal.

Mission Overview:

As a Database Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, management, and optimization of database management systems at client sites through Keystone Solutions. Your main responsibilities will include:

Database Design:

  • Participating in the design and modeling of databases in collaboration with development teams.
  • Developing efficient, standardized database schemas that meet application needs.


Implementation and Maintenance:

  • Installing, configuring, and maintaining database management systems (DBMS) such as MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server, etc.
  • Ensuring availability, security, and integrity of data stored in databases.


Performance Optimization:

  • Monitoring database performance and implementing adjustments to ensure rapid response to queries.
  • Collaborating with development teams to optimize queries and enhance overall system performance.


Data Security:

  • Implementing robust security mechanisms to protect sensitive data.
  • Managing access rights to databases and ensuring compliance with security standards.


Backup and Recovery:

  • Developing effective backup strategies and ensuring data recovery in case of incidents.
  • Regularly testing backup and recovery procedures.


Documentation:

  • Maintaining comprehensive documentation of databases, including structure, stored procedures, and configurations.
  • Training users and team members on the efficient use of databases.


Profile:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field.
  • Proven experience in database administration.
  • In-depth knowledge of MS-SQL database software, including writing SQL queries, performance optimization, data migration, and scheduling management.
  • Knowledge of Oracle and Sybase is a plus.
  • Basic skills in server management (Windows and Linux), hypervisors (vmWare, XenServer), and storage units.
  • Good knowledge of Windows and/or Linux OS and some knowledge of Middleware (optional).
  • Ability to work independently and effectively collaborate within a team.
  • Ability to actively and effectively participate in conversations in English.
  • Resilient, autonomous, and proactive.
  • Meticulous and organized.
  • Demonstrating strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Service-oriented mindset.
  • Willingness to participate in on-call duties and support roles.


If you are ready to tackle technical and strategic challenges in a dynamic consultancy environment, apply today at Keystone Solutions Career Portal.

4209424251,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/microsoft-bi-azure-and-powerbi-consultant-at-keyrus-4209424251?position=10&pageNum=15&refId=KoJ9x%2FrPrnamnjr6F2oPtQ%3D%3D&trackingId=lz57DaJ3qpIX5%2FAgBzMokQ%3D%3D,"Microsoft BI, Azure and PowerBI Consultant",Keyrus,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Your role Matters

Keyrus Data Intelligence is currently looking for BI consultants from medior to senior level, with expertise in Microsoft BI (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, DQS, MDS, Power BI, Azure) to join its expanding team. If you‚Äôre passionate about business intelligence and would like to join a leader in consulting and solutions integration for business intelligence, big data & analytics and performance management on the Belgian market please read on‚Ä¶
Depending on your seniority and ambitions, you will have different responsibilities which might include:
Helping to build and modify OLAP environments
Building reports using input gathered from either the project managers or business owners
Developing the Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing solutions by using the Microsoft BI-Suite (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, Power BI, Azure)
Collaborating or developing the complete architectural set-up

You will have the opportunity to further develop your knowledge in the latest versions of Microsoft BI applications as well as learn new modules, or to choose a path that interests you. Whether in analysis, other reporting tools, ETL, data warehousing design, implementation or migration, Keyrus will have a project to match your ambition and will help you to build a valuable and successful career.

You will have the opportunity of participating in end-to-end projects in a variety of domains from business intelligence, data warehousing, data quality, data integration and big data to corporate performance management in various industries including banking, retail, manufacturing and distribution.

If you feel you have what it takes to add value to our experienced team, if you want to thrive in a challenging environment of collaboration and flexibility, if you are eager to learn new skills to achieve your full potential and if you are a team player, then Keyrus is the right company for you!

Professional experience as a consultant with a first practical hands-on experience in Microsoft BI (Microsoft SQL server Reporting Services, Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services, Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services, Power BI, Data Quality Services, Master Data Services,‚Ä¶)
Knowledge of other BI tools will be considered a plus
Knowledge in other Microsoft BI modules is a plus
Good understanding of the data warehouse life cycle and its architecture
Strong communication skills both on the business and technical side
Being able to work both independently and as part of a team is very important
Fluent in Dutch and/or French and English
And How We Reward You Matters...

Keyrus offers a working environment and projects that attract the best people working in Data, Digital and Business Transformation. Working on diverse and challenging projects, you will have the opportunity to develop multi-disciplinary skills to help you build a strong career path.

To support you in this we have a digital learning platform with access to over 30,000 training courses as well as courses created by our experts. We dedicate a generous training budget that allows you to manage your career path at a pace that suits you.

We have also implemented an Agile Performance Management framework, where strength-based coaching, aligned company goals, alongside regular check-ins and feedback managed throughout the year are at the heart of our people management strategy.
Our generous and flexible salary package gives you the choice between:
A mobility budget that you can utilize for sustainable transportation, housing costs (rent or mortgage) and/or cash
Traditional petrol or electric car and a fuel card
On top of these two options, you will also receive net allowances, eco vouchers, hospitalisation (DKV) insurance & group insurance and a bonus scheme to use on our cafeteria plan.

Keyrus gives you the chance to develop your career alongside leaders in data, digital and management and transformation. Our project and clients at the heart of data and digital transformation changing the world we live in for the better, making data matter.
Keyrus, creator of value in the era of Data and Digital.

Keyrus is dedicated to helping enterprises take advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Keyrus in Belgium employs 200 highly skilled consultants and is part of the international Keyrus Group, an international player in consulting and technologies and a specialist in Data and Digital. Created in 1996, listed on Euronext's Eurolist, with consolidated revenues of ‚Ç¨351.89m in 2022 and with more than 3500 employees in 26 countries, the Keyrus Group offers the performance, solidity and know-how of a large professional services organisation, whilst preserving the agility of a young company.

Keyrus is a specialist in performance management consulting and the integration of innovative technological solutions in the Data and Digital fields. Since 1996, the Group has developed its expertise and skills in helping companies to optimise their performance and meet the challenges linked to their transformation. Find out more on our services on keyrus.com/be.

Leading e-commerce client now requires a Technical Business Analyst, with event storming and event modeling skills, to join a crucial programme.
Evaluate and document how systems integrate and data flows between different architectural layers.
Write high level epics and break them down into stories with acceptance criteria for each story.
Gather technical/non-technical requirements while working with third party suppliers.
Assist scrum teams to continuously refine and size the backlog.
Talk to an array of stakeholders to gather requirements, definition and elaboration.
Experience working as a Technical Business Analyst
Strong knowledge of event storming, event modeling and domain driven design

Essential: Experience working with microservices and APIs ‚Äì Ability to understand how APIs work and how to test them, understand requests and responses and experience with Postman, SOAP UI, SwaggerAPI or similar tools.
Educated to degree level or equivalent experience
This is a 6 month contract opportunity that provides a daily rate up to ‚Ç¨750 per day
In terms of office location, this role is based in Brussels, and will require 1 day per week onsite

Technical Business Analyst contract (Event Storming / Event Modeling) - ‚Ç¨750 per day


Leading e-commerce client now requires a Technical Business Analyst, with event storming and event modeling skills, to join a crucial programme.



The role:

  • Evaluate and document how systems integrate and data flows between different architectural layers.
  • Define as-is/to-be processes.
  • Write high level epics and break them down into stories with acceptance criteria for each story.
  • Gather technical/non-technical requirements while working with third party suppliers.
  • Assist scrum teams to continuously refine and size the backlog.
  • Talk to an array of stakeholders to gather requirements, definition and elaboration.


About you:

  • Experience working as a Technical Business Analyst
  • Strong knowledge of event storming, event modeling and domain driven design
  • Strong business process modeling experience
  • Essential: Experience working with microservices and APIs ‚Äì Ability to understand how APIs work and how to test them, understand requests and responses and experience with Postman, SOAP UI, SwaggerAPI or similar tools.
  • Educated to degree level or equivalent experience


This is a 6 month contract opportunity that provides a daily rate up to ‚Ç¨750 per day


In terms of office location, this role is based in Brussels, and will require 1 day per week onsite

4189586681,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/pl-sql-developer-at-in4matic-4189586681?position=2&pageNum=17&refId=u%2BBqHMWQAtTUshSP%2BHcgJA%3D%3D&trackingId=Hm8G0ShGLmAD1aym2kRE3w%3D%3D,PL/SQL Developer,In4Matic,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","We're seeking a skilled PL/SQL Developer to strengthen our client's team, which is responsible for maintaining and enhancing an Oracle-based application landscape. If you're someone with a passion for creating efficient and high-quality solutions while adhering to governance and quality standards, this might be your next challenge.
Develop and maintain Oracle-based applications using tools like PL/SQL, Forms, Reports, and APEX.
Focus on batch programming, applying complex rules for large-scale data processing.
Perform tuning and optimization to ensure high performance of the systems.
Contribute to the ongoing transition of certain software components to a new Java architecture.
Strong knowledge of Oracle development tools (PL/SQL, Forms, Reports, APEX).
Proven expertise in batch programming and handling large datasets.
Experience with performance tuning and optimization techniques.
Analytical skills to assess the impact of changes and translate customer requirements into structured solutions.
Excellent communication skills to navigate a complex IT environment.
Nice to have: Familiarity with Big Data technologies such as Spark and Scala
Nice to have: Knowledge of modern Java architecture, including Java, React, Microservices, and Kafka
Able to work up to 1 day a week onsite in the Brussels office

We're seeking a skilled PL/SQL Developer to strengthen our client's team, which is responsible for maintaining and enhancing an Oracle-based application landscape. If you're someone with a passion for creating efficient and high-quality solutions while adhering to governance and quality standards, this might be your next challenge.

Responsibilities And Key Tasks

  • Develop and maintain Oracle-based applications using tools like PL/SQL, Forms, Reports, and APEX.
  • Focus on batch programming, applying complex rules for large-scale data processing.
  • Perform tuning and optimization to ensure high performance of the systems.
  • Contribute to the ongoing transition of certain software components to a new Java architecture.


Required Skills And Expertise

  • Strong knowledge of Oracle development tools (PL/SQL, Forms, Reports, APEX).
  • Proven expertise in batch programming and handling large datasets.
  • Experience with performance tuning and optimization techniques.
  • Analytical skills to assess the impact of changes and translate customer requirements into structured solutions.
  • Excellent communication skills to navigate a complex IT environment.
  • Nice to have: Familiarity with Big Data technologies such as Spark and Scala
  • Nice to have: Knowledge of modern Java architecture, including Java, React, Microservices, and Kafka


Must Have Qualifications

  • Fluent in Dutch and English
  • Able to work up to 1 day a week onsite in the Brussels office

4190406199,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/large-language-model-researcher-at-business-and-engineering-solutions-bes-4190406199?position=6&pageNum=17&refId=u%2BBqHMWQAtTUshSP%2BHcgJA%3D%3D&trackingId=pwsohU6vDqHxCRX%2Bt%2BbIVw%3D%3D,Large Language Model Researcher,Business and Engineering Solutions (BES),"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","In this role, you will be responsible for developing a machine-learning model that monitors and analyzes time series data in real-time in the motorsport sector.

If you are a team player who thrives on responsibility, possesses strong analytical skills, and has a deep understanding of time series and deep learning methods, then you are the right person for this challenge.
You develop, evaluate and adapt algorithms available in the time series literature,
You stay updated with the latest advancements in foundation models and time series analysis,
You implement algorithms and maintain the code repository,
You collaborate with researchers and engineers to train, test and evaluate the model,
You create and support demonstrations using actual systems, prepare field tests,
You have a Master in Computer sciences or other related topics. A PhD is a plus,
You are fluent in English (written and spoken),
You have minimum 3 years of experience,
You are interested in working in a sector at the heart of innovation,
You have knowledge with Python, Matlab, Simulink,
You have experience with Python libraries: Pandas, Scikit-learn
You have expertise with time series and foundation models,
You have strong analytical and problem solving skills, with good attention to detail.
What can you except as a B.E.S. consultant?
Great projects in Engineering and High Technologies through major players to develop your technical skills and hard skills
Knowledge sharing processes though our competences centers and experts' communities to grow your multi-sectorial knowledge
A strong development plan to improve your soft skills such as Leadership, Communication skills, Change & People management capabilities‚Ä¶
A full package made of gross salary on 13.92 months, lunch allowance, entertainment expenses, company car & fuel card or mobility plan, group insurances OR a VIE!
A friendly, lively working environment within a dynamic and motivated team !!

If you are a team player who thrives on responsibility, possesses strong analytical skills, and has a deep understanding of time series and deep learning methods, then you are the right person for this challenge.


Your responsibilities :

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.
Data Processing and ETL Development ‚Äì Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights ‚Äì Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration ‚Äì Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation ‚Äì Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting ‚Äì Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support ‚Äì Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.
Technical Proficiency ‚Äì Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills ‚Äì Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure ‚Äì Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) ‚Äì Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication ‚Äì Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving ‚Äì Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.
Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities

  • Data Processing and ETL Development ‚Äì Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
  • Analysis and Insights ‚Äì Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
  • Collaboration ‚Äì Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
  • Automation ‚Äì Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
  • Documentation and Reporting ‚Äì Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
  • Customer Support ‚Äì Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.



Skills and Abilities

  • Technical Proficiency ‚Äì Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
  • Statistical and Analytical Skills ‚Äì Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
  • Data Engineering Exposure ‚Äì Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
  • GIS (Preferred but Not Required) ‚Äì Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
  • Communication ‚Äì Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Problem-Solving ‚Äì Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.

Qualifications

  • Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
  • Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
  • Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
  • Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
  • Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

4208126674,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-and-reporting-analyst-at-lombard-odier-group-4208126674?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=cacs0YQD8jOEB25UNDqfAA%3D%3D,Data and Reporting Analyst,Lombard Odier Group,"Geneva, Switzerland","A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.

With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.

‚ÄúRethink Everything‚Äù is our philosophy ‚Äì it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.

We report on the evolution of LOIM‚Äôs Financials (Assets under Management, Revenues and Costs) to various internal and external stakeholders. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.

We are looking for a Business Insight Analyst to join our Ancillaries & Strategy team in Chiasso. This is a great opportunity to apply your analytical skills and contribute to improving business performance through data-driven insights.

The candidate will be primarily involved in the Ancillaries area, focusing on pricing strategies, customer segmentation, and market behavior analysis. The role involves supporting development teams with data and insights, helping to shape product roadmaps and enhance the group‚Äôs digital assets.
The candidate will also have the opportunity to present findings to senior management, gaining valuable exposure to strategic decision-making and C-level stakeholders.
Team - you will join the Ancillaries & Strategy team within the Operations - Platform department.
Analyzing big data, determining customer trends and delivering insight to drive business performance
Closely partner with Product team, driving decision making and strategy with data and analytical insight
Executing multiple projects across teams to successfully achieve specific goals and objectives
Implementing strategies and defining models to accelerate and optimize revenue growth
1-3 years of experience in Data/Business analyst role in a fast-paced environment
Proven experience of delivering value thanks to data-driven analysis
Excellent knowledge of Excel and SQL programming language
Fluency in English both written and verbal
Ability to influence decision-makers through presentation of analysis
Familiarity with digital and e-commerce business
Previous experience in the travel industry
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you‚Äôll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.

- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O‚Äôreilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)
Wish you were here? We do, too!
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)
Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.
Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.
HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.
Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.
HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.
You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.
You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.
You speak English fluently (French is a plus).
You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.
HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?
This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.
Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment
Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
  • Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
  • Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
  • Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
  • Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
  • Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.
