4195448430,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-m-f-d-at-chaberton-professionals-4195448430?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=xIO6uX%2FtKF96Mx0R5gmj1g%3D%3D,Data Analyst (m/f/d),Chaberton Professionals,"Lucerne, Switzerland","Founded in Switzerland, Chaberton Professionals is the Management Recruitment division of Chaberton Partners, specializing in the search and selection of middle and senior management profiles. For the past seven years, we have reinforced our Swiss presence with key offices in Lugano, Zurich, Geneva, Lausanne, and Bern, supported by our team of 230 experienced Consultants and Board Members.

Our client is an industrial multinational player leader in its industry. To support the set-up of their global procurement Center of Excellence in Switzerland, we are supporting them in the search for an experienced Data Analyst based in Root, Lucerne.
The person will facilitate the procurement team with a centralized spend analytics database that supports data-driven decision making, identification of savings opportunities and savings tracking.
Create and maintain the company‚Äôs global procurement database:
-Bring together spend data from multiple ERPs into one unified platform for analytics
-Normalize, cleanse, and classify data to support global analytics
-Ongoing spend data refresh from existing and new ERPs
Work with category leads to define useful analytics.
Design visualizations to present data in a clear and concise manner for relevant stakeholders.
Develop should cost modeling and support Category Leads in using model.
Develop total cost of ownership calculations and support Category Leads in using calculator
Track and report CoE value generation.
Support Business Partners in interfacing with Finance on reporting and budgeting.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Analytics, Finance, or related field.
Experience in a similar role demonstrating strong analytics, data normalization and cleansing, ERP understanding, data visualization, and stakeholder management.
Ability to comfortably work with large datasets.
Demonstrated ability to partner with and manage internal stakeholders.
Proven experience in leveraging data analytics for strategic decision-making.
Strong financial reporting background with expertise in collaborating with finance teams.
Familiarity with advanced analytics tools and reporting frameworks.
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, SQL, and/or Python.
Fluent spoken and written English, any other language is a plus.
Type of position: Permanent, full-time position

We care about each application. Should you not hear from us within two weeks, it would imply that we have proceeded with other candidates based on the specific requirements of the role. Please note that this decision does not reflect your skills or professional experience but is rather based on the specific needs and requirements of the current position.

Founded in Switzerland, Chaberton Professionals is the Management Recruitment division of Chaberton Partners, specializing in the search and selection of middle and senior management profiles. For the past seven years, we have reinforced our Swiss presence with key offices in Lugano, Zurich, Geneva, Lausanne, and Bern, supported by our team of 230 experienced Consultants and Board Members.


Data Analyst (m/f/d)


The position:

Our client is an industrial multinational player leader in its industry. To support the set-up of their global procurement Center of Excellence in Switzerland, we are supporting them in the search for an experienced Data Analyst based in Root, Lucerne.

The person will facilitate the procurement team with a centralized spend analytics database that supports data-driven decision making, identification of savings opportunities and savings tracking.


Main responsibilities:

  • Create and maintain the company‚Äôs global procurement database:

-Bring together spend data from multiple ERPs into one unified platform for analytics

-Normalize, cleanse, and classify data to support global analytics

-Ongoing spend data refresh from existing and new ERPs

  • Create and update category dashboards
  • Work with category leads to define useful analytics.
  • Design visualizations to present data in a clear and concise manner for relevant stakeholders.
  • Develop should cost modeling and support Category Leads in using model.
  • Develop total cost of ownership calculations and support Category Leads in using calculator
  • Track and report CoE value generation.
  • Support Business Partners in interfacing with Finance on reporting and budgeting.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Analytics, Finance, or related field.
  • Experience in a similar role demonstrating strong analytics, data normalization and cleansing, ERP understanding, data visualization, and stakeholder management.
  • Ability to comfortably work with large datasets.
  • Demonstrated ability to partner with and manage internal stakeholders.
  • Proven experience in leveraging data analytics for strategic decision-making.
  • Strong financial reporting background with expertise in collaborating with finance teams.
  • Familiarity with advanced analytics tools and reporting frameworks.
  • Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, SQL, and/or Python.
  • Fluent spoken and written English, any other language is a plus.


Location: Root, Switzerland

Type of position: Permanent, full-time position


We care about each application. Should you not hear from us within two weeks, it would imply that we have proceeded with other candidates based on the specific requirements of the role. Please note that this decision does not reflect your skills or professional experience but is rather based on the specific needs and requirements of the current position.

4198001997,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-%E2%80%93-supply-chain-at-unilabs-switzerland-4198001997?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=lB5xgmiYvUGd0d10TDFnmQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst ‚Äì Supply Chain,Unilabs Switzerland,"Coppet, Vaud, Switzerland","Introduction
Unilabs is the largest provider of medical laboratory diagnostics for prescribers and hospitals in Switzerland and employs around 800 people.

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our Supply Chain team to support our company transformation project. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing supply chain data, identifying trends, and providing insights to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and optimize processes. The Data Analyst will collaborate closely with other departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
Data Collection & Management: Gather, clean, and manage large datasets from various sources, including internal ERP systems and external suppliers.

Data Analysis: Perform in-depth analysis to identify trends, bottlenecks, and inefficiencies in supply chain processes such as inventory management, lead times, supplier performance, and transportation.

Reporting & Visualization: Develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders. Utilize tools like Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or similar software.
Forecasting & Modeling: Support inventory optimization, and capacity planning using statistical models and data analysis techniques.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and alignment with supply chain goals.
Process Improvement: Provide actionable insights to improve supply chain performance, reduce costs, and enhance customer satisfaction through data-driven strategies.
Key Performance Indicators & Metrics: Track and analyze supply chain KPIs.
Ad Hoc Analysis: Conduct special projects and analyses as needed to support strategic initiatives in the supply chain function.
Experience: minimum 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within supply chain, logistics, or manufacturing industries.
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in supply chain management, Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent.
Experience with database management and querying (e.g., SQL) is an advantage.
Experience with ERP migration is an advantage.
Knowledge of supply chain management systems (ERP, WMS) is a plus.
Analytical Mindset: Strong problem-solving skills and ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present findings clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to Detail: High degree of accuracy and attention to detail when working with complex datasets.
Languages: Advanced command of English. and French or German

A leading commodities firm is looking for a skilled Quantitative Analyst to strengthen its Trading Risk & Quant Analytics Team. This role focuses on XVA pricing methodologies and supporting the development of a Quant Library, offering a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
Strong grasp of derivatives pricing and risk concepts.
Proficiency in Python programming (knowledge of C++ or other languages is beneficial).
Strong ability to collaborate across different teams and functions.
Quick adaptability to new ideas and problem-solving approaches.
Experience in delivering optimised and well-structured code.
Designing and refining quantitative models and analytical tools.
Working closely with teams across the business, including Trading, Middle Office, Risk, Credit, and Technology.
Evaluating XVA-related risks associated with new transactions.
A Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a numerical field such as Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, Science, or Finance.
A minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience in an XVA quant role - ideally within commodities (including CVA/FVA), though experience in rates or FX will also be considered.
Proven ability to write robust, production-level code using best practices (source control, CI/CD pipelines, unit/regression testing).
Direct interaction with Trading, Risk, Credit, Middle Office, and IT teams.
Reports to the XVA Lead covering energy and commodity trading.

Holcim Trading & Shipping (HTS) is the trading arm of Holcim Group, the world leader in the building materials industry. HTS is specialized to meet the needs of customers and suppliers around the world through a unique product and service portfolio provided from offices in Zurich, Singapore and Miami.

HTS delivers solutions for the seaborne import and export needs of cementitious materials, gypsum, solid fuels and other dry bulk goods. Teams of dedicated specialists manage a diverse network of seaborne logistics, operating bulk carrier vessels and specialized cement carriers. HTS is a leading international trader, meeting the needs of the cement/construction industry worldwide.

At Holcim, there is endless opportunity for you to play your part. Whether you‚Äôre in a technical, managerial, or frontline role, you can shape a career that works for you. With us you‚Äôll have the chance to embrace the passion we share for our planet. You‚Äôll be encouraged to seek out diverse perspectives, share your ideas and build the skills and connections you need to perform at your best. Because it‚Äôs only when we work together in a culture where everyone thrives, that we can build the world we all want to live in.
Join our amazing team and contribute as a:

The Market Analyst is responsible for the collection, processing, maintenance, reporting and analysis of Business Intelligence data in Holcim Trading. The position will play a key role in supporting specific growth initiatives of our company while helping us drive sustainability and innovation in construction and trading practices. This is a unique opportunity to work on exciting and new projects, develop valuable skills, and contribute to meaningful change in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
Read, screen, analyze raw data coming from various sources on a day to day basis, either quantitative data (flows statistics, customs statistics, port statistics, ‚Ä¶) or qualitative

Suggest and contribute to automations of data processing and management
Conduct in-depth market research and analysis to identify emerging trends, customer needs, and opportunities for growth. Utilize findings to develop strategies that align
Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key clients, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and retention.
Evaluate and assess potential risks associated with projects, materials, and market trends.
Develop mitigation strategies to protect the company from potential setbacks.
Lead customer-facing communication efforts, including presentations, client meetings, and social media outreach. Collaborate with internal teams to ensure
customer expectations are met and exceeded.
Promote and implement sustainable building practices and materials, ensuring alignment with the company‚Äôs overall vision of environmental responsibility and innovation.
Master‚Äôs degree in Management, Entrepreneurship, or equivalent

Ideally, 1-2 years of experience in a customer-facing role (B2B or B2C) with international exposure, business development, or sustainability-related projects (internships, part-time roles, or project work are highly valued).
A passion for sustainability, innovation, and helping businesses thrive in a rapidly changing world.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to connect with people and build meaningful relationships.

Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively in a diverse and dynamic environment.

Summary Of The Job

The Market Analyst is responsible for the collection, processing, maintenance, reporting and analysis of Business Intelligence data in Holcim Trading. The position will play a key role in supporting specific growth initiatives of our company while helping us drive sustainability and innovation in construction and trading practices. This is a unique opportunity to work on exciting and new projects, develop valuable skills, and contribute to meaningful change in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.

Main Activities / Responsibilities

Data Management:

  • Read, screen, analyze raw data coming from various sources on a day to day basis, either quantitative data (flows statistics, customs statistics, port statistics, ‚Ä¶) or qualitative
  • Conduct relevant research using various sources, from electronic database, websites, and other published sources, using sophisticated search engines, query tools, and other web


technologies

  • Set up/maintain/improve our commodities databases, statistics and related news
  • Suggest and implement new ideas to make the data management more efficient
  • Suggest and contribute to automations of data processing and management


Market Analysis &
column5:
Strategy:

with the company‚Äôs sustainability goals.

customer expectations are met and exceeded.

Master‚Äôs degree in Management, Entrepreneurship, or equivalent

Ideally, 1-2 years of experience in a customer-facing role (B2B or B2C) with international exposure, business development, or sustainability-related projects (internships, part-time roles, or project work are highly valued).

A passion for sustainability, innovation, and helping businesses thrive in a rapidly changing world.

Knowledge and skills:

  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to connect with people and build meaningful relationships.
  • Public speaking by engaging diverse audiences at high-profile international events, showcasing the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively.
  • A proactive and problem-solving mindset, willing to take initiative and think creatively.
  • Familiarity with social media platforms (experience in content creation or digital marketing is a plus).
  • A fundamental knowledge of the construction industry, sustainability trends, and basic legal frameworks.

  • Entwicklung von Schulungsunterlagen, Unterst√ºtzung bei Onboarding und aktive Beteiligung an cross-funktionalen Projekten


Das bringen Sie mit

  • Abgeschlossenes oder laufendes Studium in IT, Data Science, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einem verwandten Bereich
  • Erfahrung mit CRM-Systemen, idealerweise Veeva, sowie fundierte Kenntnisse in Excel (inkl. Pivot-Tabellen, Power Query)
  • Analytisches Denkverm√∂gen und Erfahrung mit Power BI oder √§hnlichen Visualisierungstools
  • Ausgepr√§gte Kommunikations- und Teamf√§higkeit sowie Pr√§sentationssicherheit
  • Selbstbewusstes, proaktives Auftreten und Erfahrung in lateraler Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
column3:
Franz√∂sischkenntnisse sind von Vorteil


Our Company

Why Boehringer Ingelheim?

With us, you can develop your own path in a company with a culture that knows our differences are our strengths \u2013 and break new ground in the drive to make millions of lives better.

Here, your development is our priority. Supporting you to build a career as part of a workplace that is independent, authentic and bold, while tackling challenging work in a respectful and friendly environment where everyone is valued and welcomed.

Alongside, you have access to programs and groups that ensure your health and wellbeing are looked after \u2013 as we make major investments to drive global accessibility to healthcare. By being part of a team that is constantly innovating, you'll be helping to transform lives for generations.

Want to learn more? Visit https://www.boehringer-ingelheim.com

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland

Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance

We want candidate who holds recent experience as well as who is more inclined on Advisory BA (order management) not IT BA.

To act as a talented Business Analyst in our team dedicated to the business line Alternative Advisors, for which we develop and maintain custom-made applications and integrate COTS packages. Today, our applications run on premises, but we have started our journey to the public cloud. In that future environment, we are building new data pipelines using modern cloud-native technologies and leverage SaaS business solutions.
Mandatory practical experience in Finance, and Private Assets as business analyst, business engineer
Previous experience with eFront and underlying data
Advanced capabilities in SQL, XLS (DBT and Python are a plus)
Collaborative mindset - Have proven experience where his/her capacity to foster collaboration has made a strong difference
Relevant practical experience working with agile framework
Experience of SaaS business solution integration is a plus, in particular in Alternative Investment
Passion for continuous improvements. Not satisfied with the status quo and always thinking of ways to improve
An intuitive eye for customer needs beyond the obvious
Resistance to pressure and changing environment
Functional and technical support of agile Data projects in the financial sector/banking environment throughout the entire life cycle
Specifying requirements as a business analyst using requirements engineering & modelling techniques, business cases
Developing solutions with internal and external stakeholders
Actively contribute to internal topics and implement your own ideas - thereby driving your own professional, methodological, and personal development and that of your environment
Establishing data quality assessment rules aligned with business lines to assist data engineers in automating calculations and report generation.

Job Description:

Data Business Analyst (Private Assets)

We want candidate who holds recent experience as well as who is more inclined on Advisory BA (order management) not IT BA.

To act as a talented Business Analyst in our team dedicated to the business line Alternative Advisors, for which we develop and maintain custom-made applications and integrate COTS packages. Today, our applications run on premises, but we have started our journey to the public cloud. In that future environment, we are building new data pipelines using modern cloud-native technologies and leverage SaaS business solutions.

Skills/Experience Required:

  • Mandatory practical experience in Finance, and Private Assets as business analyst, business engineer
  • Previous experience with eFront and underlying data
  • Advanced capabilities in SQL, XLS (DBT and Python are a plus)
  • Collaborative mindset - Have proven experience where his/her capacity to foster collaboration has made a strong difference
  • Relevant practical experience working with agile framework
  • Experience of SaaS business solution integration is a plus, in particular in Alternative Investment
  • Rigorous and analytical mindset
  • Passion for continuous improvements. Not satisfied with the status quo and always thinking of ways to improve
  • An intuitive eye for customer needs beyond the obvious
  • Excellent attention to details
  • Very good communicator
  • Resistance to pressure and changing environment
  • Fluent in French and English

Responsibilities:

  • Functional and technical support of agile Data projects in the financial sector/banking environment throughout the entire life cycle
  • Specifying requirements as a business analyst using requirements engineering &
column2:
modelling techniques, business cases
  • Developing solutions with internal and external stakeholders
  • Actively contribute to internal topics and implement your own ideas - thereby driving your own professional, methodological, and personal development and that of your environment
  • Establishing data quality assessment rules aligned with business lines to assist data engineers in automating calculations and report generation.

4203244069,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-m-w-d-80-100%25-at-serv-swiss-export-risk-insurance-4203244069?position=46&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=DWcm8173598mF9IoCpbUQA%3D%3D,"Data Analyst (m/w/d, 80 - 100%)",SERV Swiss Export Risk Insurance,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Die Schweizerische Exportrisikoversicherung SERV ist eine √∂ffentlich-rechtliche Organisation des Bundes. Sie versichert Exportgesch√§fte von Schweizer Unternehmen gegen politische und wirtschaftliche Risiken und stellt so den Zahlungseingang sicher. Auf diese Weise leistet die SERV einen Beitrag zur Schaffung und Erhaltung von Arbeitspl√§tzen und der F√∂rderung des Wirtschaftsstandortes Schweiz.

Wir suchen an unserem Standort in Z√ºrich eine/n motivierte/n Data Analyst (m/w/d), der sich in der Welt der Datenanalyse weiterentwickeln m√∂chte. In dieser Position wist du Teil eines zweier Teams und unterst√ºtzt bei der Verarbeitung und Analyse von vielf√§ltigen Datenquellen.
Zusammenf√ºhren von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Datenbest√§nden aus unterschiedlichen Formaten und Datenquellen
Aufbereiten der zusammengef√ºhrten Daten f√ºr die Auswertung in Analyse-Werkzeugen
Erstellung von aussagekr√§ftigen Reports zu durchgef√ºhrten Datenanalysen, um relevante Erkenntnisse zu kommunizieren
Integration automatisierter Datenanalysen in bestehende Prozesse, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu f√∂rdern
Beratung bei der Durchf√ºhrung von Auswertungen sowie Unterst√ºtzung bei der kontinuierlichen Optimierung und Dokumentation von Datenanalysen und -Werkzeugen
Abgeschlossenes Bachelor- oder Master-Studium in Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik oder einem vergleichbaren Bereich
Du bringst erste Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse und Interesse an modernen Analyse-Werkzeugen und Datenvisualisierung mit
Zudem hast du Erfahrung mit SQL und MS-SQL Datenbanken, Kenntnisse in Python oder R sind von Vorteil
Teamgeist, Kommunikationsf√§higkeit und eine proaktive Arbeitsweise sowie sehr gute Kenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch (in Wort und Schrift)
Lernbereitschaft und die Motivation, sich im Bereich Datenanalyse weiterzuentwickeln

Hybrides Arbeitsmodell und zentrales, modernes B√ºro direkt in der Stadt Z√ºrich

Die Schweizerische Exportrisikoversicherung SERV ist eine √∂ffentlich-rechtliche Organisation des Bundes. Sie versichert Exportgesch√§fte von Schweizer Unternehmen gegen politische und wirtschaftliche Risiken und stellt so den Zahlungseingang sicher. Auf diese Weise leistet die SERV einen Beitrag zur Schaffung und Erhaltung von Arbeitspl√§tzen und der F√∂rderung des Wirtschaftsstandortes Schweiz.


Wir suchen an unserem Standort in Z√ºrich eine/n motivierte/n Data Analyst (m/w/d), der sich in der Welt der Datenanalyse weiterentwickeln m√∂chte. In dieser Position wist du Teil eines zweier Teams und unterst√ºtzt bei der Verarbeitung und Analyse von vielf√§ltigen Datenquellen.


Deine Aufgaben

  • Zusammenf√ºhren von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Datenbest√§nden aus unterschiedlichen Formaten und Datenquellen

Dein Profil

  • Zudem hast du Erfahrung mit SQL und MS-SQL Datenbanken, Kenntnisse in Python oder R sind von Vorteil
  • Teamgeist, Kommunikationsf√§higkeit und eine proaktive Arbeitsweise sowie sehr gute Kenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch (in Wort und Schrift)

This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4203172835,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-internship-12-months-at-kanadevia-inova-4203172835?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=ZxvWOUEPCz8afyc13ZFoyQ%3D%3D,Data Science Internship (12 months),Kanadevia Inova,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Company Description
Welcome to Kanadevia Inova, a global innovation leader in the waste infrastructure space, where we believe in creating a sustainable future through technology and innovation.
At Kanadevia Inova, we pride ourselves on being at the forefront of waste-to-X technology. We are not just waste managers
column2: we are creators of value from what communities discard. Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

column1: The Advanced Digitalization, of the Technology and Digitalization department, is developing innovative digital products to support our customers maximizing the performance of their plants. In this role you will be supporting R&D projects, under the supervision of Data Scientists, on the following tasks:
Support the specification of technical requirements, technical design of ML based products.
Conduct data exploration studies to develop concepts and validate ideas and hypotheses.
Contribute to the development of machine learning models.
Develop and maintain data labelling and annotation processes.
Develop and maintain product performance monitoring reports, focusing on machine learning performance metrics.
Contribute to the monitoring and maintenance of Azure cloud resources (e.g. Azure ML Studio).
Currently enrolled or completed BSc or MSc degree in a STEM degree (e.g. Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Mechanical or Electronic Engineering)
Exposure to python from studies, internships, or any other practical experience
Good command of English both written and verbal
Self-motivation and disciplined work ethics with a strong interest in self-learning
Responsible challenge with diversified field of activity
Team-oriented working atmosphere in an international Company
Personal development opportunities through own Inova Academy
Opportunity to gain an insight into various technical disciplines
Attractive working place (central, good transport links)
For HR agencies: Please note that we do not accept applications coming from agencies. Thank you.

At Kanadevia Inova, we pride ourselves on being at the forefront of waste-to-X technology. We are not just waste managers
column2:
we are creators of value from what communities discard. Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

column3:
D projects, under the supervision of Data Scientists, on the following tasks:

  • Contribute to the monitoring and maintenance of Azure cloud resources (e.g. Azure ML Studio).

4189926468,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-quantitative-analyst-at-np-group-4189926468?position=51&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=W2N%2FKL8rdBzJQmOPg4OkDQ%3D%3D,Senior Quantitative Analyst,NP Group,"Geneva, Switzerland","Job Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst

My client, a leader in their field is looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to assist in supporting the Trading Desks day-to-day. Helping the desks understand Risk / PnL, discussing and developing Trading Tools (Excel, Python) and enhancing the existing analytics library (C++).

The role represents an excellent opportunity for a Quant to work alongside Interest Rate and FX Traders, understand how these markets behave and deliver trading tools and analysis. You will be required to stay up to date on the latest technologies and market developments and researching these and implementing where appropriate.
The primary asset classes in focus will be Rates and FX - with some exposure to Credit and Equity.
Maintain and build Front Office Trading/Analysis tools
Potential to develop core analytics library
Dialogue with Traders, Risk Managers and other departments as necessary
Deputise for the Head of Quant Analysis as required
5-10 years hands-on experience as a FO Quant/Strat
Knowledge and a passion for Interest Rate and/or FX markets and analytics
Good degree in a quantitative discipline

Job Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst

Type: Full-Time

Start Date - ASAP

Location ‚Äì Geneva, Switzerland


JOB DESCRIPTION:


My client, a leader in their field is looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to assist in supporting the Trading Desks day-to-day. Helping the desks understand Risk / PnL, discussing and developing Trading Tools (Excel, Python) and enhancing the existing analytics library (C++).


DUTIES &
column2:
RESPONSIBILITIES:


The role represents an excellent opportunity for a Quant to work alongside Interest Rate and FX Traders, understand how these markets behave and deliver trading tools and analysis. You will be required to stay up to date on the latest technologies and market developments and researching these and implementing where appropriate.

The primary asset classes in focus will be Rates and FX - with some exposure to Credit and Equity.


Duties will involve:

  • Day-to-day support of Trading Desks
  • Maintain and build Front Office Trading/Analysis tools
  • Potential to develop core analytics library
  • Dialogue with Traders, Risk Managers and other departments as necessary
  • Deputise for the Head of Quant Analysis as required


EXPERIENCE:


  • 5-10 years hands-on experience as a FO Quant/Strat
  • Knowledge and a passion for Interest Rate and/or FX markets and analytics
  • Good degree in a quantitative discipline


TECHNICAL SKILLS:

Essential

  • Python
  • Excel/VBA


Desirable

  • C++
  • ML / AI
  • SQL

To strengthen our Strategic Affairs department, we are looking for an:
ECONOMIC DATA ANALYSIS INTERNSHIP (6 month contract)
Gain experience on real economic data analysis case studies based on business activities and internal needs
Collaborate to the collection and treatment of macro-economic and fiscal data by using, among other tools, Excel and STATA
Realize econometric testing of time series data
Support the team in econometric modelling
Bachelor or Master student in Finance, Economics, Mathematics or any other relevant fields
Proficient in MS Office and excellent command of Excel
Fluent in both English and French
Our success comes from our highly skilled and talented employees
Respectful entrepreneurship and long-term vision are key for success
Our people contribute to a more secure world
Diversity at all levels of an organization is a strength

column2:

Our Company

Why Boehringer Ingelheim?

With us, you can develop your own path in a company with a culture that knows our differences are our strengths \u2013 and break new ground in the drive to make millions of lives better.

Here, your development is our priority. Supporting you to build a career as part of a workplace that is independent, authentic and bold, while tackling challenging work in a respectful and friendly environment where everyone is valued and welcomed.

Alongside, you have access to programs and groups that ensure your health and wellbeing are looked after \u2013 as we make major investments to drive global accessibility to healthcare. By being part of a team that is constantly innovating, you'll be helping to transform lives for generations.

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

4203172835,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-internship-12-months-at-kanadevia-inova-4203172835?position=2&pageNum=5&refId=N8OrMX%2Fx0EvQ9uZjgXp2ig%3D%3D&trackingId=jBhWahFDfxn1c7GlFkdy1g%3D%3D,Data Science Internship (12 months),Kanadevia Inova,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Company Description
Welcome to Kanadevia Inova, a global innovation leader in the waste infrastructure space, where we believe in creating a sustainable future through technology and innovation.
At Kanadevia Inova, we pride ourselves on being at the forefront of waste-to-X technology. We are not just waste managers
column2: we are creators of value from what communities discard. Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

column1: The Advanced Digitalization, of the Technology and Digitalization department, is developing innovative digital products to support our customers maximizing the performance of their plants. In this role you will be supporting R&D projects, under the supervision of Data Scientists, on the following tasks:
Support the specification of technical requirements, technical design of ML based products.
Conduct data exploration studies to develop concepts and validate ideas and hypotheses.
Contribute to the development of machine learning models.
Develop and maintain data labelling and annotation processes.
Develop and maintain product performance monitoring reports, focusing on machine learning performance metrics.
Contribute to the monitoring and maintenance of Azure cloud resources (e.g. Azure ML Studio).
Currently enrolled or completed BSc or MSc degree in a STEM degree (e.g. Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Mechanical or Electronic Engineering)
Exposure to python from studies, internships, or any other practical experience
Good command of English both written and verbal
Self-motivation and disciplined work ethics with a strong interest in self-learning
Responsible challenge with diversified field of activity
Team-oriented working atmosphere in an international Company
Personal development opportunities through own Inova Academy
Opportunity to gain an insight into various technical disciplines
Attractive working place (central, good transport links)
For HR agencies: Please note that we do not accept applications coming from agencies. Thank you.

we are creators of value from what communities discard. Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

4189926468,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-quantitative-analyst-at-np-group-4189926468?position=3&pageNum=5&refId=N8OrMX%2Fx0EvQ9uZjgXp2ig%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FxW5SbU1mcOC41tVJ2mz3A%3D%3D,Senior Quantitative Analyst,NP Group,"Geneva, Switzerland","Job Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst

My client, a leader in their field is looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to assist in supporting the Trading Desks day-to-day. Helping the desks understand Risk / PnL, discussing and developing Trading Tools (Excel, Python) and enhancing the existing analytics library (C++).

The role represents an excellent opportunity for a Quant to work alongside Interest Rate and FX Traders, understand how these markets behave and deliver trading tools and analysis. You will be required to stay up to date on the latest technologies and market developments and researching these and implementing where appropriate.
The primary asset classes in focus will be Rates and FX - with some exposure to Credit and Equity.
Maintain and build Front Office Trading/Analysis tools
Potential to develop core analytics library
Dialogue with Traders, Risk Managers and other departments as necessary
Deputise for the Head of Quant Analysis as required
5-10 years hands-on experience as a FO Quant/Strat
Knowledge and a passion for Interest Rate and/or FX markets and analytics
Good degree in a quantitative discipline

Job Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst

Type: Full-Time

Start Date - ASAP

Location ‚Äì Geneva, Switzerland


JOB DESCRIPTION:


My client, a leader in their field is looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to assist in supporting the Trading Desks day-to-day. Helping the desks understand Risk / PnL, discussing and developing Trading Tools (Excel, Python) and enhancing the existing analytics library (C++).


DUTIES &
column2:
RESPONSIBILITIES:


The role represents an excellent opportunity for a Quant to work alongside Interest Rate and FX Traders, understand how these markets behave and deliver trading tools and analysis. You will be required to stay up to date on the latest technologies and market developments and researching these and implementing where appropriate.

The primary asset classes in focus will be Rates and FX - with some exposure to Credit and Equity.


Duties will involve:

  • Day-to-day support of Trading Desks
  • Maintain and build Front Office Trading/Analysis tools
  • Potential to develop core analytics library
  • Dialogue with Traders, Risk Managers and other departments as necessary
  • Deputise for the Head of Quant Analysis as required


EXPERIENCE:


  • 5-10 years hands-on experience as a FO Quant/Strat
  • Knowledge and a passion for Interest Rate and/or FX markets and analytics
  • Good degree in a quantitative discipline


TECHNICAL SKILLS:

Essential

  • Python
  • Excel/VBA


Desirable

  • C++
  • ML / AI
  • SQL

4198700201,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/marketing-data-analytics-at-shein-4198700201?position=10&pageNum=5&refId=VrZqH6YtE2URJqOiI2CURA%3D%3D&trackingId=p4IqqHjBvkRfaUt1Bd9N6g%3D%3D,Marketing Data Analytics,SHEIN,"S√£o Paulo, S√£o Paulo, Brazil","ABOUT SHEIN

SHEIN is a global online fashion and lifestyle retailer, offering SHEIN branded apparel and products from global network of vendors, all at affordable prices. Headquartered in Singapore, SHEIN remains committed to making the beauty of fashion accessible to all, promoting its industry-leading, on demand production methodology, for a smarter, future-ready industry. Founded in 2012, SHEIN has more than 16,000 employees operating from offices around the world, and continues to expand operations globally. Join SHEIN and be the future!

We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment that enables us to tap into our diversity of strengths and unlock our collective potential through the work that we do. Employees benefit from working in a dynamic, global business that is leading the way in innovation by encouraging creativity and disruption to ensure that we are evolving the business for the better.
We Empower Talents with Diverse Careers

At SHEIN, we empower talent to excel with regular opportunities to elevate their career in their respective fields. As a dynamic business, we support internal mobility, diverse career pathways and recognition of success and contribution in a variety of meaningful ways.

SHEIN has over 20 offices worldwide , providing talent with many opportunities to collaborate with colleagues around the world. Perspective sharing and leveraging cultural differences, is one of our core strenghts as we work on many exciting projects and draw insights from industry-leading experience.
We are looking for a Fashion Analytics Specialist to join our team. This role involves using data to improve our performance in several key areas:

- Livestream: Develop strategies to improve GMV and UV during livestream events. Analyze performance metrics to refine and drive successful streaming experiences also crossing data with products and themes according to our audience.

- Pop-up Store Strategy: Work on initiatives to increase ROI and manage costs effectively within pop-up store projects. Utilize data-driven insights to maximize GMV and elevate customer needs and desires.
- Fashion Campaign Performance: Lead the analysis of fashion campaign performance, providing strategies to boost GMV and ROI while ensuring a captivating consumer experience with the campaign.

- Fashion Research: Maintain an up-to-date understanding of the fashion industry landscape by researching current trends, analyzing key data points, and applying insights to align with market demands and consumer preferences.
- Data Analysis and Trend Identification: Use data tools to understand market trends and customer behavior, turning insights into actionable strategies.
Join us and help shape the future of fashion with smart data solutions!
- Experience in the fashion industry, with a focus on analytics and trend research.
- Experience in data analysis tools (such as Tableau) and methodologies.
- Ability to simplify complex data insights into effective strategies.
- Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate insights to cross-functional teams.
- Creative problem solver with a proactive approach.

At SHEIN, we believe that diversity is the force that drives innovation. We are committed to creating an environment where all voices are heard, valued and respected. All our vacancies are inclusive for people with disabilities, women, black people, LGBTQIAPN+ community and all types of diversity.

ABOUT SHEIN

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are looking for a Fashion Analytics Specialist to join our team. This role involves using data to improve our performance in several key areas:

Join us and help shape the future of fashion with smart data solutions!



Qualifications:

- Fluent in English

- Experience in the fashion industry, with a focus on analytics and trend research.

- Ability to simplify complex data insights into effective strategies.

- Creative problem solver with a proactive approach.



At SHEIN, we believe that diversity is the force that drives innovation. We are committed to creating an environment where all voices are heard, valued and respected. All our vacancies are inclusive for people with disabilities, women, black people, LGBTQIAPN+ community and all types of diversity.

Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.
Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse di Roma.
La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing, Econometrics e molto altro! Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.
Integrazione dei dati: capire quali fonti di dati sono importanti e come devono essere trattate al fine di potenziare nuovi strumenti e metodologie Data Driven
Modellazione: sviluppo di nuovi modelli Statistici e di Machine Learning ad hoc per soddisfare le richieste e i requisiti aziendali
Piattaforme di analisi avanzate: Sviluppo di pipeline ML complete, dall'ingestione dei dati alle applicazioni frontend

Incontri ed eventi orientati al business: concentrandosi fortemente sulla condivisione con gli utenti aziendali dei dettagli del progetto, si costruisce la fiducia nello strumento e nella metodologia utilizzata per svilupparlo.
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una Laurea in Data Science, Statistica, Matematica/Ingegneria Matematica, o altra ritenuta attinente
Hai una buona conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione come Python, R, SAS

Hai competenze nella comprensione del ciclo di vita dei modelli: preparazione dei dati dell'ultimo miglio, sviluppo di modelli statistici e di intelligenza artificiale e distribuzione in un'infrastruttura cloud
Hai una buona conoscenza di: Data Warehouse, estrazione, manipolazione e preparazione dei dati

Hai competenze di base di Data Visualization, con soluzioni Enterprise (es. PowerBI) o soluzioni open-source come ggplot o plotly, e magari anche di visualizzazione di dati geografici tramite sistemi GIS e/o librerie geografiche (geopandas)
Hai conoscenze generali di statistica economica (grandezze macroeconomiche, contabilit√† Istat, numeri indice, serie storiche economiche e finanziarie, statistica territoriale) e di econometria
Sai consultare le fonti statistiche ufficiali (Istat, Eurostat, Banca d‚ÄôItalia, Fondo Monetario Internazionale, Banca Mondiale, OCSE, ecc.)
Hai competenze di base con le principali piattaforme cloud (Azure, AWS)
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero.
Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformit√† del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni concrete che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.

*6 months paid internship in the Customer Care and Field Force Effectiveness team
*Being part of one of the main players in the VET industry, leader in its sector, ranked among Best Workplace 2023 & Best Workplace for Women 2023
*Collaboration and participation in international projects/teams within SEC
*Developing proficiency with CRM Tools, databases, Excel, Power BI, PowerPoint
Department: Customer Care and Field Force Effectiveness
*The candidate will support the Customer Care and Field Force Effectiveness team
* Degree in Economics, Marketing or similar
*Knowledge of Spanish and/or experience abroad (Eg. Erasmus program) is a plus.
*Team player, proactive and open to innovation
Personal and professional development - being part of one of the main VET players

At Zoetis, our purpose is to nurture the world and humankind by advancing care for animals. As a Fortune 500 company and the world leader in animal health, we discover, develop, manufacture and commercialize vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and other technologies for companion animals and livestock. We know our people drive our success. Our award-winning culture, built around our Core Beliefs, focuses on our colleagues' careers, connection and support. We offer competitive healthcare and retirement savings benefits, along with an array of benefits, policies and programs to support employee well-being in every sense, from health and financial wellness to family and lifestyle resources.

Connected to our purpose and Core Beliefs, at Zoetis, we lead with inclusion. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) focus helps create an environment where each colleague can thrive. Our commitment to DE&I begins with our leadership team of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ethnicities, and it is demonstrated in our support of our colleagues and the animal health industry. We have nine colleague resources groups whose members spread awareness, foster inclusivity and make a positive impact on our business and communities.

Our commitment to advancing Diversity, Equity and Inclusion has earned us recognitions as a 2024 Catalyst Award recipient and a Top 50 Company for Workplace Fairness by Fair360 (formerly DiversityInc). Zoetis has also been named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality, a Best Company for Working Parents, a Top Company for Executive Women, among many others. Learn more here.

TRAINEE CRM BUSINESS ANALIST (post - graduate)

OPPPORTUNITY:

*6 months paid internship in the Customer Care and Field Force Effectiveness team

*Being part of one of the main players in the VET industry, leader in its sector, ranked among Best Workplace 2023 &
column2:
Best Workplace for Women 2023

*Collaboration and participation in international projects/teams within SEC

*Developing proficiency with CRM Tools, databases, Excel, Power BI, PowerPoint

Location: Rome - hybrid

Department: Customer Care and Field Force Effectiveness

MAIN ACTIVITIES:

*The candidate will support the Customer Care and Field Force Effectiveness team

with a particular focus on

  • Data analysis and KPIs monitoring
  • Territories alignment and optimization
  • Customer segmentation
  • Field Force training activities

TARGET PROFILE:

* Degree in Economics, Marketing or similar

*English proficient

*Knowledge of Spanish and/or experience abroad (Eg. Erasmus program) is a plus.

*Team player, proactive and open to innovation

*Creative and problem solver

*Good communicator

OFFICE and PERKS:

  • Personal and professional development - being part of one of the main VET players
  • Central office location (Vatican Area)
  • Smart working policy (2days/week)
  • Company events/team building/collaborative environment
  • Mobile and laptop.

At Zoetis, our purpose is to nurture the world and humankind by advancing care for animals. As a Fortune 500 company and the world leader in animal health, we discover, develop, manufacture and commercialize vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and other technologies for companion animals and livestock. We know our people drive our success. Our award-winning culture, built around our Core Beliefs, focuses on our colleagues' careers, connection and support. We offer competitive healthcare and retirement savings benefits, along with an array of benefits, policies and programs to support employee well-being in every sense, from health and financial wellness to family and lifestyle resources.

Flutter, the world‚Äôs largest online sports betting and iGaming group listed on the London and New York stock exchanges, is home to the Southern Europe & Africa (SEA) region, featuring iconic brands like Sisal and PokerStars, a globally loved brand that embodies innovation and ambition, with significant growth potential in a dynamic market.
Support the analysis of business performance, identifying trends and opportunities across Casino, Poker, and Sports Betting.
Work with commercial, marketing, and operations teams to develop data-driven insights that improve acquisition, retention, and customer experience
Assist in building dashboards, reports, and visualizations to supervise important metrics and evaluate campaign efficiency.
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to answer key business questions and support strategic decision-making.
Support A/B testing initiatives to optimize user engagement and conversion rates.
Collaborate with senior analytics and commercial leaders to identify new opportunities for growth.
Proven track record in analysing business performance and identifying key trends and opportunities.
Experience in data manipulation, business intelligence and reporting tools.
On field experience in testing web content and implementing user optimization strategies.
Passion for sports and online gaming is a nice-to-have.
Strong teamwork and cross-functional collaboration skills, working with multiple departments.
The option to join our company Share Saving Scheme.
An inclusive work environment and participate in all our initiatives focused on Diversity & Inclusion
Well-Being Support: online meditation courses, medical online service and counselling with the help of certified psychologists and coaches

4206918775,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analytics-insight-internship-at-procter-gamble-4206918775?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=adstMVo53Lwgcz6PxjhlkA%3D%3D&trackingId=hgXfr%2BjxxHTa%2Fb6o3Eh7ZQ%3D%3D,Analytics & Insight Internship,Procter & Gamble,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Job Location

Do you have a passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision and the media landscape? An ambition to drive the change through deep consumer understanding and advanced analytics is also what we are looking for!
If so, then this role is perfect for you!

In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it and how we can we influence them through immersive exploration and big data analytics. We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.
A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.
As an intern in Analytics and Insights, you will:
Act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G Top management in several business domains (consumer, customer, digital etc.)
Be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth
Combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions

Grow your skills continuously, improving your mastery in big data analytics, as well as immersive in-depth researches. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal and external guides worldwide.
Responsibilities as of Day 1 ‚Äì You will be given specific projects and responsibilities working on real and live business challenges, just like a true P&Ger
Continuous coaching ‚Äì You will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager
Dynamic and respectful work environment ‚Äì Employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting work/life balance
Compensation & Benefits: you will receive a competitive internship salary as well as other benefits whilst you are with us.
Just apply online via clicking the button below
Attach any documents you consider relevant: motivation letter, recommendations, certificates etc.
Master students or recent graduates with strong analytical skills and Integrative thinking
Proven leadership and teamwork skills, with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù approach and an unusual skew to innovate
Boundless curiosity and the passion to generate results
Data Analytics background represents a plus
Have creativity, innovation, initiative and follow-through with your goals, along with strong written and verbal communication skills
Are fluent in Italian and have an excellent ability to communicate in English
Are available for a minimum of 3 months, preferably 6 months internship.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate against individuals based on race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.
At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.
Our mission of Diversity and Inclusion is: ‚ÄúEveryone valued. Everyone included. Everyone performing at their peak‚Äù.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

4210631607,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-0-experience-required-at-peroptyx-4210631607?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=adstMVo53Lwgcz6PxjhlkA%3D%3D&trackingId=aSbru2D0PwOheMgtHwkUqQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst (0 Experience Required),Peroptyx,"Rome, Latium, Italy","For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.
So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!
Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.


At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.


As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.


With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.


So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!


Benefits

  • Work up to 20 hours per week.
  • Earn a competitive rate of pay.
  • Develop your research skills.
  • Avoid the long commute.
  • Work from the comfort of your home office.
  • Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!


Ideal Candidate

  • Fluent in English and Italian.
  • Excellent research skills.
  • Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
  • Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
  • Analytical mindset.


Job Requirements

  • Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
  • Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
  • Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
  • Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
  • Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
  • All work must be of an independent nature.

We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join the Advanced Analytics Data Platform team for the development of data flows within the company's Data Platform and the distribution of integrated Artificial Intelligence solutions across all business areas.
At least 2 years of experience in the role
Familiarity with Apache Spark and the Hadoop ecosystem
Depending on seniority, the candidate will be responsible for one or more of the following activities:
Implementation of data consumption pipelines (export pipelines, APIs)
Basic knowledge of Bash and Unix operating systems
Familiarity with MongoDB and NoSQL databases
Experience with SQL Server and Integration Services (SSIS)
Experience in designing cloud-on-premise integration architectures
Expertise in database design, data access strategies and mechanisms, data security and integrity control, engineering services, and distributed systems
What you will find in Lottomatica:
Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world
Work in a dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment
Permanent contract and hybrid work opportunities
Continuous training on hard and soft skills
Annual gross salary commensurate with experience (40-45K)

Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination. At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment. We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

4195481260,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/director-analyst-master-data-management-mdm-remote-at-gartner-4195481260?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=adstMVo53Lwgcz6PxjhlkA%3D%3D&trackingId=kIS3hB%2BHAucgEYjAkohUrA%3D%3D,"Director Analyst, Master Data Management (MDM), Remote",Gartner,"Rome, Latium, Italy","About the role:

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Senior Director serves as a leader within Gartner‚Äôs Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels.

Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner‚Äôs value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.

The successful candidate is a subject matter expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and understands its application across people, processes, and technologies. The candidate will focus on written and customer-facing deliverables to support Data & Analytics Leaders who face the challenges of improving/establishing/reviving MDM initiatives. This role will require in depth knowledge of the MDM Market in addition to a strategic level understanding of the topic.
Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged ‚Äúmust-have research‚Äù content
Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act
Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client‚Äôs barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward
Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a team of analysts
Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda
Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights
Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions
Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings

Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business
Provide high quality and timely research content peer review
Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy
Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community
Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research & Advisory provide excellent service delivery
Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions
Subject matter expertise, with demonstrated knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) Strategy.
Deep understanding of the MDM market including (but not limited to): who the key players are, what core capabilities are required, the evolution of the market.
Detailed knowledge of one or more MDM Product(s), hands on experience of implementing an MDM solution is a plus.
Bachelor's Degree, Advanced Professional Qualification, or 10+ years direct experience in a field related to Data and Analytics.

column1: Strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply
Subject matter expert comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements
Deep knowledge of the global and competitive landscape within subject area as well as the interplay in that market
Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team
Learning agile and adept with navigating highly matrixed environments
Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels
Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable)

You came from a Data & Analytics background and may have been a hands-on practitioner in the past but as your career progressed you may have transitioned into a leadership role, where you started leading teams or teams of teams.
You understand the bigger picture and the full lifecycle of data where considerations are made in governance, quality, integration, reusability, and management.
You are proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data

column1: You enjoy learning and being challenged intellectually on new topic areas or adjustments to previously held beliefs.
You are versatile and able to pivot to new topics to match the challenges faced by our clients.
You are a strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
You are a subject matter expert who is comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements.
You can demonstrate executive presence and can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders.
What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?
You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.
You are always learning and looking to discover what‚Äôs next in technology.
You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.
You love to shape ideas and business-related recommendations to solve clients‚Äô biggest challenges.
At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

4187475253,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-ai-consultant-senior-consultant-roma-at-pwc-italy-4187475253?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=adstMVo53Lwgcz6PxjhlkA%3D%3D&trackingId=kXA6P92c20JzdYLtyqxkXQ%3D%3D,Data & AI Consultant | Senior Consultant - Roma,PwC Italy,"Rome, Latium, Italy","At PwC, our people in data and analytics focus on leveraging data to drive insights and make informed business decisions. They utilise advanced analytics techniques to help clients optimise their operations and achieve their strategic goals. In business intelligence at PwC, you will focus on leveraging data and analytics to provide strategic insights and drive informed decision-making for clients. You will develop and implement innovative solutions to optimise business performance and enhance competitive advantage.

Focused on relationships, you are building meaningful client connections, and learning how to manage and inspire others. Navigating increasingly complex situations, you are growing your personal brand, deepening technical expertise and awareness of your strengths. You are expected to anticipate the needs of your teams and clients, and to deliver quality. Embracing increased ambiguity, you are comfortable when the path forward isn‚Äôt clear, you ask questions, and you use these moments as opportunities to grow.
Examples of the skills, knowledge, and experiences you need to lead and deliver value at this level include but are not limited to:
Respond effectively to the diverse perspectives, needs, and feelings of others.
Use a broad range of tools, methodologies and techniques to generate new ideas and solve problems.
Use critical thinking to break down complex concepts.
Understand the broader objectives of your project or role and how your work fits into the overall strategy.
Develop a deeper understanding of the business context and how it is changing.
Use reflection to develop self awareness, enhance strengths and address development areas.
Interpret data to inform insights and recommendations.
Uphold and reinforce professional and technical standards (e.g. refer to specific PwC tax and audit guidance), the Firm's code of conduct, and independence requirements.
